editorialNote.content: The title of this Regulation was amended from “Electoral Procedure (Village Representative Election) Regulation” to “Electoral Procedure (Rural Representative Election) Regulation” — see 5 of 2014 s. 2.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: adjournment (押後), in relation to a poll or the counting of the votes in respect of a poll, means an adjournment under section 72(2) or 73, and adjourned (押後) shall be construed accordingly;
Assistant Presiding Officer (助理票站主任) means a polling officer designated as an Assistant Presiding Officer under section 31(2)(b); (L.N. 163 of 2021)
Assistant Returning Officer (助理選舉主任) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;
ballot paper account (選票結算表) means a statement prepared under section 54;
ballot paper sorting station (選票分流站) means a place designated as a ballot paper sorting station under section 28; (L.N. 134 of 2009)
close of nominations (提名期結束) means the end of the nomination period;
Composite Indigenous Village (共有代表鄉村) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;
computer (電腦), in relation to the counting of votes, includes any device and computer software that is designed and programmed to count the votes cast at an election; (5 of 2014 s. 37)
counting agent (監察點票代理人) means a counting agent appointed under section 56;
counting of the votes (點票) includes separation, sorting and counting of ballot papers; (L.N. 134 of 2009)
counting officer (點票人員), in relation to a counting station, means a person appointed under section 57(1) as a counting officer for that counting station; (L.N. 163 of 2021)
counting station (點票站) means a counting station designated under section 28 and includes a ballot paper sorting station; (L.N. 134 of 2009)
counting zone (點票區) means an area set apart as a counting zone under section 58(1);
dedicated polling station (專用投票站) means a place designated as a dedicated polling station under section 28; (L.N. 134 of 2009)
Deputy Presiding Officer (副票站主任) means a polling officer designated as a Deputy Presiding Officer under section 31(2)(a); (L.N. 163 of 2021)
election (選舉) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;

def.name: ElectionAdvertisement
def.leadIn: election advertisement (選舉廣告), in relation to an election, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a publicly exhibited notice, leaflet, circular, bill, booklet, placard or poster;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: a public announcement made by radio or television or by video or cinematographic film; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other form of publication,

def.continued: published for the purpose of promoting or prejudicing the election of a candidate or candidates at the election; (11 of 2012 s. 19)

subsection.def: election agent (選舉代理人) means an election agent appointed under section 22;
election expense agent (選舉開支代理人) means an election expense agent appointed under section 23;
election expenses (選舉開支) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554);
Election Ordinance (《選舉條例》) means the Rural Representative Election Ordinance (Cap. 576); (5 of 2014 s. 2)
elector (選民) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;
electoral officer (選舉事務主任) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance and includes a Presiding Officer, a polling officer and a counting officer;
Electoral Registration Officer (選舉登記主任) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;
Existing Village (現有鄉村) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;
identity card (身分證) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;

def.name: InCustody
def.leadIn: in custody (受羈押), in relation to a person, means the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serving a sentence of imprisonment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: detained by the Correctional Services Department on remand; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: otherwise detained by any law enforcement agency under any lawful authority; (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.def: Indigenous Village (原居鄉村) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;
Kaifong Representative (街坊代表) has the same meaning as in section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance; (5 of 2014 s. 37)

def.name: LawEnforcementAgency
def.leadIn: law enforcement agency (執法機關) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Customs and Excise Department;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Police Force;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Immigration Department;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Independent Commission Against Corruption; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other department of the Government any officer of which is empowered by any Ordinance to exercise a power of arrest; (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.def: Market Town (墟鎮) has the same meaning as in section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance; (5 of 2014 s. 37)
maximum security prison (高度設防監獄) means a prison which is specified as a maximum security prison under rule 47A(1)(b) of the Prison Rules (Cap. 234 sub. leg. A); (L.N. 134 of 2009)
no canvassing zone (禁止拉票區) means an area determined to be a no canvassing zone under section 34;
no staying zone (禁止逗留區) means an area determined to be a no staying zone under section 34;
nomination period (提名期) means the period determined under section 5;

Officer-in-charge (主管), in relation to a counting station, means—(a)for a counting station other than a ballot paper sorting station—(i)if a Presiding Officer is appointed under section 57(1B) for that counting station—the Presiding Officer; or(ii)if no such Presiding Officer is appointed—(A)if the counting station is used for counting the votes for 1 Rural Area—the Returning Officer appointed for that Rural Area; or(B)if the counting station is used for counting the votes for more than one Rural Area—any of the Returning Officers appointed for those Rural Areas; or(b)for a ballot paper sorting station—the Assistant Returning Officer appointed under section 57(1A) to preside at that station; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

def.name: OrdinaryBusinessHours
def.leadIn: ordinary business hours (通常辦公時間) means the hours—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. on any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday (other than a general holiday); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: between 9 a.m. and 12 noon on a Saturday (other than a general holiday) during the period between—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of publication of a notice under section 4(1) or 6 in respect of an election; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date of publication of the result of the election under the Rural Representative Election Ordinance (Cap. 576) or the date of the declaration of the failure or termination of the election under that Ordinance, whichever is the later; (12 of 2014 s. 95)

subsection.def: political body (政治性團體) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Societies Ordinance (Cap. 151);
polling agent (監察投票代理人) means a polling agent appointed under section 36;

def.name: PollingDay
def.leadIn: polling day (投票日), in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a rural ordinary election, means the date specified under section 20(3)(a) of the Election Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a rural by-election, means the date referred to in section 6(c); (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.def: polling station (投票站) means a polling station designated under section 28 and includes a dedicated polling station; (L.N. 134 of 2009)
postponement (延遲), in relation to a poll or the counting of the votes in respect of a poll, means a postponement under section 72(1), and postponed (延遲) shall be construed accordingly;

Presiding Officer (票站主任) means—(a)in relation to a polling station, the person appointed under section 31(1)(a) as the Presiding Officer for that polling station; or(b)in relation to a counting station, the person appointed under section 57(1B) as the Presiding Officer for that counting station; (L.N. 163 of 2021)
principal residential address (主要住址) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;
Resident Representative (居民代表) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;
Rural Area (鄉郊地區) has the same meaning as in section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance; (5 of 2014 s. 37)
rural by-election (鄉郊補選) has the same meaning as in section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance; (5 of 2014 s. 37)
rural by-election notice (鄉郊補選公告) means a notice published under section 6; (5 of 2014 s. 37)
rural election notice (鄉郊選舉公告) means a notice published under section 4; (5 of 2014 s. 37)
rural ordinary election (鄉郊一般選舉) has the same meaning as in section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance; (5 of 2014 s. 37)
Rural Representative (鄉郊代表) has the same meaning as in section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance; (5 of 2014 s. 37)
spoilt ballot paper (損壞的選票) means a ballot paper endorsed in the manner described in section 52(3);
unused ballot paper (未用的選票) means a ballot paper that has been issued but not put into a ballot box, whether or not it has been endorsed in the manner described in section 51;

verification statement (核實報表) means a statement prepared under section 60A(1)(d), 60B(1)(d), (5)(c) or (6)(c), 61(3)(b) or 64(1)(d); (L.N. 134 of 2009; L.N. 77 of 2011; 12 of 2014 s. 73; L.N. 163 of 2021)
Village (鄉村) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance. (5 of 2014 s. 37)

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in sections 20(8), 79, 80 and 82 and Parts 4 (except section 32), 5, 6 and 7, a reference to a candidate shall be construed as a reference to a validly nominated candidate standing for an election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in sections 9(1), 22 and 32, a reference to a candidate includes a reference to a person who is being or has been nominated to stand for an election;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in sections 23 and 26 and Part 10, a reference to a candidate includes a reference to a person who has publicly declared an intention to stand for an election at any time before the close of nominations; and (11 of 2012 s. 19)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in section 24, a reference to a candidate includes a reference to a person referred to in paragraph (b) or (c).

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), a reference to the Returning Officer is, in relation to a Rural Area, a reference to the Returning Officer appointed for that Rural Area; and (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in sections 33(1), 35(1), (5) and (6), 37(9), 38(1), (2), (3)(j), (4), (7) and (8) and 82(1)(e), a reference to the Returning Officer is, in relation to a polling station used for polling for more than one Rural Area, a reference to any of the Returning Officers appointed for those Rural Areas. (L.N. 134 of 2009; L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.content: In this Regulation, any provision which entitles or permits a candidate, an election agent, a polling agent or a counting agent to do anything in a polling station, counting station, counting zone or in relation to the counting of the votes shall be construed as entitling or permitting the candidate or the agent to do it in a polling station, counting station, counting zone or in relation to the counting of the votes for the Rural Area for which the candidate is standing for election or for which the agent is appointed, as the case may be. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Effect of inclement weather warning on date and period

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: gale warning (烈風警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);
inclement weather warning day (惡劣天氣警告日) means a working day on which a gale warning or a rainstorm warning is in force at any time during ordinary business hours;
rainstorm warning (暴雨警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday other than a general holiday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a Saturday (other than a general holiday) during the period between—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of publication of a notice under section 4(1) or 6 in respect of an election; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date of publication of the result of the election under the Rural Representative Election Ordinance (Cap. 576) or the date of the declaration of the failure or termination of the election under that Ordinance, whichever is the later.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a date is prescribed in this Regulation (whether by reference to a specific day of a specific month or to a day otherwise ascertainable under this Regulation) or is fixed under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an act is required or permitted by a provision of this Regulation to be done not later than, or on or before, the date or on the date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: the next working day, which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the date is taken to be prescribed or fixed in relation to the act instead for the provision.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period is prescribed in or fixed under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an act is required or permitted by a provision of this Regulation to be done in, during or within the period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the last day of the period falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: the period is extended, in relation to the act, to end on the next working day, which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the day mentioned in paragraph (c), and the provision has effect accordingly.

subsection.content: Subsections (2) and (3) are subject to Part 8.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application

subsection.content: Except where otherwise stated, this Regulation applies to a rural ordinary election and a rural by-election.
Parts 4, 5 and 6 are to be read, in their application to a rural by-election, subject to necessary modifications.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Nomination of Candidates and other Stages of an Election before the Poll

section.name: s3A
section.heading: Interpretation (Part 2)
section.def: relevant particulars (有關詳情), in relation to the principal residential address of a candidate for an election of Resident Representative or Kaifong Representative, means the following particulars of that address—(a)the region, and the District as defined by section 2 of the District Councils Ordinance (Cap. 547);(b)for an election of Resident Representative for an Existing Village—the name of the Existing Village as specified in column 1 of Schedule 1 to the Election Ordinance;(c)for an election of Kaifong Representative for a Market Town—the name of the Market Town as specified in column 1 of Schedule 3A to the Election Ordinance.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Director of Home Affairs to publish rural election notice

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after a notice is given under section 20(3)(b) of the Election Ordinance, the Director of Home Affairs shall publish in the Gazette a notice which states—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the Rural Area for which the rural ordinary election is to be held;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of Rural Representatives (specifying whether they are Resident Representatives, Indigenous Inhabitant Representatives or Kaifong Representatives) to be returned for the Rural Area at the rural ordinary election; (5 of 2014 s. 38)

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the address of the office of the Returning Officer at which nomination forms must be delivered;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that nomination forms must be delivered during ordinary business hours;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: that a poll will be held on the polling day if the number of validly nominated candidates for the Rural Area exceeds the number of Rural Representatives to be returned for that Rural Area at the rural ordinary election; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any other information that the Director of Home Affairs considers appropriate.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), one notice may be published for more than one Rural Area.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Director of Home Affairs to determine nomination period

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the nomination period shall be determined by the Director of Home Affairs.

subsection.leadIn: The nomination period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a rural ordinary election shall not begin earlier than the day on which the rural election notice is published in the Gazette; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a rural by-election shall not begin earlier than the day on which the rural by-election notice is published in the Gazette. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: The nomination period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not be less than 7 days; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall end not less than 12 days before the polling day.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (3), the nomination period may end during the period of 12 days before the polling day if the nomination period is extended under section 2A(3). (12 of 2014 s. 16)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Director of Home Affairs to publish rural by-election notice if a rural by-election is to be held
section.leadIn: Subject to section 21(2) and (3) of the Election Ordinance, as soon as practicable after a declaration referred to in section 21(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d) of that Ordinance is made, in order to hold a rural by-election for the purposes of section 21(1) of that Ordinance, the Director of Home Affairs shall publish in the Gazette a notice which states— (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the Rural Area for which the rural by-election is to be held;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of Rural Representatives (specifying whether they are Resident Representatives, Indigenous Inhabitant Representatives or Kaifong Representatives) to be returned for the Rural Area at the rural by-election; (5 of 2014 s. 39)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date for holding the rural by-election;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: the address of the office of the Returning Officer at which nomination forms must be delivered;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: that nomination forms must be delivered during ordinary business hours;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: that a poll will be held on the polling day if the number of validly nominated candidates for the Rural Area exceeds the number of Rural Representatives to be returned for that Rural Area at the rural by-election; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: any other information that the Director of Home Affairs considers appropriate.

section.name: s7
section.heading: How to nominate a candidate

subsection.leadIn: A nomination form nominating a person as a candidate shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: contain a declaration by the person that he—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is eligible to be;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is not disqualified from being; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: consents to be,

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: contain the following information about the person—

subparagraph.content: the name shown on the person’s identity document;
the number of the person’s identity document;
for an election of Resident Representative or Kaifong Representative—the person’s principal residential address;
for an election of Indigenous Inhabitant Representative—the person’s address; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: contain the following information about each subscriber to the nomination form—

subparagraph.content: the name shown on the subscriber’s identity document;
the number of the subscriber’s identity document;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: be signed by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a holder of an identity document, who has attained the age of 18 years, as the witness to the signature of the person; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: each subscriber to the nomination form; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: be delivered—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by the person in person or in any other manner authorized by the Returning Officer;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at the address stated in the relevant rural election notice or rural by-election notice, as the case may be; (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: during ordinary business hours; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: together with the declaration referred to in section 24 of the Election Ordinance.

subsection.content: A nomination form nominating a person as a candidate may include a name of the person which is different from that shown on his identity document if the Returning Officer is satisfied that the person is usually known by that name.

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer may require a person who is nominated as a candidate to furnish such information which is not covered by the nomination form as that Officer considers necessary in order to be satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the person is eligible to be nominated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as to the validity of the nomination.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Returning Officer may assist in preparation of nomination forms
section.content: The Returning Officer may, at the request of a person who proposes to be nominated as a candidate, give assistance in preparing a nomination form.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Returning Officer may give opportunity to rectify a nomination form

subsection.leadIn: If the Returning Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: detects on the nomination form of a candidate an error or omission or anything which may affect the validity of the nomination form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: considers that it can be rectified within the nomination period,

subsection.continued: that Officer may, before making a decision under section 27 of the Election Ordinance, give the candidate a reasonable opportunity to rectify it.

subsection.content: A nomination form cannot be rectified under this section after the close of nominations.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Returning Officer to decide whether candidates are validly nominated

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall, as soon as practicable after receiving the nomination form of a candidate, decide under section 27 of the Election Ordinance whether the candidate is validly nominated.

subsection.leadIn: If sections 22, 23, 24 and 25 of the Election Ordinance are complied with, the candidate stands validly nominated unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer decides that the nomination form is invalid; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the candidate withdraws his candidature.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to sections 22, 23, 24 and 25 of the Election Ordinance, the Returning Officer may decide that a nomination form is invalid if and only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nomination form has not been signed by at least 5 subscribers qualified to subscribe to the nomination form under section 25 of the Election Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nomination form has not been completed or signed as required under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer is satisfied that the candidate is not eligible to be or is disqualified from being nominated as a candidate under the Election Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: (in the case that the nomination form relates to a particular Rural Area) the candidate has been currently nominated for another Rural Area, and the Returning Officer is satisfied that the other candidature has not been withdrawn or decided to be invalid; or (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer is satisfied that the candidate is dead.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Returning Officer to endorse invalid nomination forms
section.leadIn: If the Returning Officer decides that a nomination form or the nomination of a candidate is invalid, he shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: endorse on the nomination form the decision and the reason for it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sign the endorsement.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Returning Officer to notify decision on validity of nomination

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall, as soon as practicable after deciding that a person is validly nominated as a candidate or is not so nominated, send a written notice of the decision to the person and to each validly nominated candidate for election for the Rural Area concerned. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) must be sent to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an election of Resident Representative or Kaifong Representative—the principal residential address of the person concerned contained in the nomination form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an election of Indigenous Inhabitant Representative—the address of the person concerned contained in the nomination form. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Nomination forms to be available for inspection
section.leadIn: A copy of each of the nomination forms received by the Returning Officer shall be made available for inspection by the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: free of charge;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at an office of the Returning Officer specified by him; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: during ordinary business hours,

section.continued: until the result of election is published under section 36 of the Election Ordinance.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Withdrawal of candidature

subsection.content: A withdrawal of candidature under section 26 of the Election Ordinance is effected by delivering a notice of withdrawal to the Returning Officer before the close of nominations.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of withdrawal shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: bear the signature of the candidate, which shall be attested by a witness, and bear the witness’ signature; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: be delivered—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by the candidate in person or his election agent in person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at an office of the Returning Officer specified by him; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: during ordinary business hours.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Returning Officer to publish a notice of particulars of validly nominated candidates

subsection.leadIn: A notice under section 27(2) of the Election Ordinance shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be published in the Gazette by the Returning Officer within 14 days after the close of nominations; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: state the following information about each validly nominated candidate for election for the Rural Area concerned—

subparagraph.content: the candidate’s name;
the candidate number;
for an election of Indigenous Inhabitant Representative—the candidate’s address. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), one notice may be published for more than one Rural Area.
If one notice is to be published for more than one Rural Area under this section, the notice shall be published by the Returning Officers for those Rural Areas.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Returning Officer to declare candidate to be duly elected in uncontested election

subsection.content: A declaration under section 29(1) of the Election Ordinance shall be made by the Returning Officer in the notice published for the Rural Area concerned in accordance with section 15 or in a separate notice.

subsection.leadIn: A separate notice under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be published in the Gazette within 14 days after the close of nominations; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: state the following information about the candidate declared to be duly elected as a Resident Representative, an Indigenous Inhabitant Representative or a Kaifong Representative, as the case may be, for the Rural Area—

subparagraph.content: the candidate’s name;
for an Indigenous Inhabitant Representative—the candidate’s address. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s17
section.heading: Returning Officer to notify and declare if a validly nominated candidate is known before date of election to have died

subsection.leadIn: A notice under section 28(1) of the Election Ordinance shall be given in writing by the Returning Officer, as soon as practicable after the death of a validly nominated candidate comes to the knowledge of that Officer, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director of Home Affairs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if practicable, each candidate who remains validly nominated for election for the Rural Area concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: endorse on the nomination form of the deceased candidate that the candidate has died; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: sign the endorsement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may on the polling day, if that Officer considers it appropriate to do so, display a notice in a prominent place— (L.N. 77 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: immediately outside each polling station (other than a dedicated polling station) used for polling for the Rural Area; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: inside each dedicated polling station used for polling for the Rural Area. (L.N. 77 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: Declarations under section 28(2) of the Election Ordinance shall be made by the Returning Officer, as soon as practicable after the death of the candidate comes to the knowledge of that Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice published in the Gazette;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice published in any daily newspaper in circulation in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by a public announcement made by radio or television; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by such other means as that Officer considers appropriate in the circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (2)(b) or (3)(a) or (b) shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following information about the deceased candidate—

subparagraph.content: the candidate’s name;
for an election of Indigenous Inhabitant Representative—the candidate’s address; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: whether the deceased candidate was nominated for election— (5 of 2014 s. 41)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a Resident Representative for an Existing Village;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as an Indigenous Inhabitant Representative for an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: as a Kaifong Representative for a Market Town; (5 of 2014 s. 41)

paragraph.name: ba
c
paragraph.leadIn: the following information about each candidate who remains validly nominated for election for the Rural Area—

subparagraph.content: the candidate’s name;
for an election of Indigenous Inhabitant Representative—the candidate’s address. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: A public announcement under subsection (3)(c) shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the deceased candidate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: whether the deceased candidate was nominated for election— (5 of 2014 s. 41)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a Resident Representative for an Existing Village;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as an Indigenous Inhabitant Representative for an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: as a Kaifong Representative for a Market Town; (5 of 2014 s. 41)

paragraph.name: ba
c
paragraph.content: the name of each candidate who remains validly nominated for election for the Rural Area.

subsection.leadIn: If, before the death of the candidate comes to the knowledge of the Returning Officer, that Officer has publicly declared under section 29(1) of the Election Ordinance that the candidate was duly elected as a Rural Representative for the Rural Area— (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsections (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5) and section 19 do not apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a rural by-election shall be arranged, subject to section 21(2) and (3) of the Election Ordinance, under section 21(1) of that Ordinance.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Returning Officer to notify and declare if a validly nominated candidate is known before date of election to be disqualified

subsection.leadIn: A notice under section 28(4) of the Election Ordinance shall be given in writing by the Returning Officer, as soon as practicable after the disqualification of a validly nominated candidate comes to the knowledge of that Officer, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director of Home Affairs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if practicable, each candidate who remains validly nominated for election for the Rural Area concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: endorse on the nomination form of the disqualified candidate that that Officer’s decision made under section 27(1) of the Election Ordinance in relation to that candidate is varied and the reason for it; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: sign the endorsement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may on the polling day, if that Officer considers it appropriate to do so, display a notice in a prominent place— (L.N. 77 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: immediately outside each polling station (other than a dedicated polling station) used for polling for the Rural Area; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: inside each dedicated polling station used for polling for the Rural Area. (L.N. 77 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: Declarations under section 28(5) of the Election Ordinance shall be made by the Returning Officer, as soon as practicable after the disqualification of the candidate comes to the knowledge of that Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice published in the Gazette;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice published in any daily newspaper in circulation in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by a public announcement made by radio or television; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by such other means as that Officer considers appropriate in the circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (2)(b) or (3)(a) or (b) shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following information about the disqualified candidate—

subparagraph.content: the candidate’s name;
for an election of Indigenous Inhabitant Representative—the candidate’s address; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: whether the disqualified candidate was nominated for election— (5 of 2014 s. 42)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a Resident Representative for an Existing Village;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as an Indigenous Inhabitant Representative for an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: as a Kaifong Representative for a Market Town; (5 of 2014 s. 42)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: the name of the Rural Area for which the disqualified candidate was nominated; (5 of 2014 s. 42)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the decision of the Returning Officer made under section 27(1) of the Election Ordinance has been varied to the effect that the candidate is not validly nominated; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the following information about each candidate who remains validly nominated for election for the Rural Area—

subparagraph.content: the candidate’s name;
for an election of Indigenous Inhabitant Representative—the candidate’s address. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: A public announcement under subsection (3)(c) shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the disqualified candidate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: whether the disqualified candidate was nominated for election— (5 of 2014 s. 42)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a Resident Representative for an Existing Village;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as an Indigenous Inhabitant Representative for an Indigenous Village or a Composite Indigenous Village; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: as a Kaifong Representative for a Market Town; (5 of 2014 s. 42)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: the name of the Rural Area for which the disqualified candidate was nominated; and (5 of 2014 s. 42)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of each candidate who remains validly nominated for election for the Rural Area.

subsection.leadIn: If, before the disqualification of the candidate comes to the knowledge of the Returning Officer, that Officer has publicly declared under section 29(1) of the Election Ordinance that the candidate was duly elected as a Rural Representative for the Rural Area— (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsections (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5) and section 19 do not apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a rural by-election shall be arranged, subject to section 21(2) and (3) of the Election Ordinance, under section 21(1) of that Ordinance.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Returning Officer to declare no poll under certain circumstances upon death or disqualification of validly nominated candidate known before date of election

subsection.leadIn: If, after the death referred to in section 17(1) or the disqualification referred to in section 18(1)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: no candidate remains validly nominated for election for the Rural Area concerned; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of candidates remaining validly nominated for election for the Rural Area concerned is less than the number of Rural Representatives to be returned for the Rural Area at the election,

subsection.continued: the Returning Officer shall, by such means as referred to in section 17(3) or 18(3), as the case may be, declare that no poll is to be held for the Rural Area.

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer shall in the notice under section 17(3)(a) or 18(3)(a), as the case may be, or in a separate notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (in the case referred to in subsection (1)(a)) declare, for the purposes of section 29(1) of the Election Ordinance, the remaining candidate or candidates as being duly elected as a Rural Representative or Rural Representatives for the Rural Area;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (in the case referred to in subsection (1)(b)) declare, for the purposes of section 29(2) of the Election Ordinance, the election to have failed; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: (in the case referred to in subsection (1)(c)) declare—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: for the purposes of section 29(2) of that Ordinance, the election to have failed to the extent that the number of candidates remaining validly nominated for election for the Rural Area was less than the number of Rural Representatives to be returned for the Rural Area at the election.

subsection.leadIn: A separate notice containing a declaration referred to in subsection (2)(a) or (c)(i) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable after the publication of the notice under section 17(3)(a) or 18(3)(a), as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: state the following information about each candidate declared to be duly elected as a Rural Representative for the Rural Area—

subparagraph.content: the candidate’s name;
for an Indigenous Inhabitant Representative—the candidate’s address. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.content: A separate notice containing a declaration referred to in subsection (2)(b) or (c)(ii) shall be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable after the publication of the notice under section 17(3)(a) or 18(3)(a), as the case may be.

If a declaration referred to in subsection (2)(b) or (c)(ii) is made, a rural by-election shall be arranged, subject to section 21(2) and (3) of the Election Ordinance, under section 21(1) of that Ordinance.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Returning Officer to declare termination of election proceedings and procedure after termination

subsection.leadIn: A declaration under section 30(1) of the Election Ordinance shall be made by the Returning Officer by notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: signed by that Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: displayed in a prominent place immediately outside each polling station used for polling for the Rural Area concerned; and (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: stating the reason for, and the date and time of, the termination of the proceedings for the election concerned.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1) shall be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable after the declaration referred to in that subsection is made.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If a notice is displayed under subsection (1), the Commissioner of Correctional Services or the head of a law enforcement agency must, as soon as practicable, inform all electors in custody detained by him or her who have not yet voted in the poll of the declaration. (L.N. 77 of 2011)

If the death or disqualification of a validly nominated candidate, which is the reason for the termination of the election proceedings, comes to the knowledge of the Returning Officer on the date of election but before the close of the poll for the Rural Area, that Officer shall direct that the poll be abandoned. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

When a poll is abandoned under this section, the Presiding Officer at the polling station or each polling station used for polling for the Rural Area shall take the steps he is required to take under this Regulation for the delivery to the Returning Officer of the ballot box or ballot boxes, ballot papers and other materials relating to the election at the close of the poll. (5 of 2014 s. 2)
For the purposes of subsection (4), the requirement in section 54 relating to the preparation of a ballot paper account does not apply.

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: open the ballot box or ballot boxes delivered to him; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: make up into separate sealed packets—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all ballot papers in the ballot box or each of the ballot boxes, without separating or counting them or counting the votes; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: all other ballot papers delivered to him from the polling station or each polling station.

subsection.content: Sections 70 and 71 apply to the ballot papers and materials delivered to the Returning Officer under subsection (4) as if they were ballot papers and documents sent to the Director of Home Affairs under section 69.

subsection.leadIn: When a poll is abandoned under this section, the Returning Officer shall, as far as practicable and in such manner as that Officer considers appropriate, notify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director of Home Affairs; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the candidates for election for the Rural Area or their respective election agents. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.content: If a declaration referred to in subsection (1) is made, a rural by-election shall be arranged, subject to section 21(2) and (3) of the Election Ordinance, under section 21(1) of that Ordinance. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

section.name: s21
section.heading: Returning Officer to declare failure of election under certain circumstances upon death or disqualification of validly nominated candidate known after close of poll

subsection.content: If the death or disqualification of a validly nominated candidate comes to the knowledge of the Returning Officer after the close of the poll but before the declaration of the result of the election for the Rural Area concerned, that Officer shall direct that the counting of the votes is to begin or continue, as the case may be, as if the death or disqualification had not occurred.

If, after the votes are counted, the deceased or disqualified candidate is found to be not successful at the election, the Returning Officer shall declare the successful candidate or candidates to be elected in accordance with section 66(1).

subsection.leadIn: If, after the votes are counted, the deceased or disqualified candidate is found to be successful at the election, the Returning Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not declare that candidate to be elected; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall make a declaration under section 30(3) of the Election Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A declaration referred to in subsection (3)(b) shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by notice—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: signed by the Returning Officer; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: displayed in a prominent place immediately outside the counting station for counting the votes for the Rural Area; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by a public announcement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: made in the counting station for counting the votes for the Rural Area; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: by radio or television; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: by such other means as the Returning Officer considers appropriate in the circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (4)(a) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the election has failed and the reason for it; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (in the case referred to in section 30(3)(b) of the Election Ordinance) that the election has failed to the extent that the number of candidates returned for the Rural Area at the election was less than the number of Rural Representatives to be returned for that Rural Area at the election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable after the declaration referred to in subsection (3)(b) is made.

subsection.content: If a declaration referred to in subsection (3)(b) is made, a rural by-election shall be arranged, subject to section 21(2) and (3) of the Election Ordinance, under section 21(1) of that Ordinance.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Election Agents and Election Expense Agents

section.name: s22
section.heading: Appointment of election agent

subsection.content: Each candidate may appoint one person as his election agent.
Only a holder of an identity card, who has attained the age of 18 years, may be appointed as an election agent.

subsection.leadIn: An election agent appointed by a candidate may do all things which the candidate may do or is required to do under this Regulation in connection with an election except— (12 of 2014 s. 78)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making a declaration referred to in section 24 of the Election Ordinance or section 7(1)(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: signing a nomination form as the candidate being nominated;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signing a notice of withdrawal of candidature referred to in section 14(2) as the candidate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: appointing an election agent under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: appointing an election expense agent under section 23;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: incurring election expenses on behalf of the candidate, unless he has also been appointed by the candidate as the candidate’s election expense agent under section 23; (L.N. 134 of 2009)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: revoking the appointment of an election agent or election expense agent under section 24(4); (L.N. 134 of 2009)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (i), being present in a dedicated polling station situated in a prison unless, upon an application in the specified form delivered by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission to the Returning Officer at least one week before polling day, the Commissioner of Correctional Services consents to his presence; and (L.N. 134 of 2009; 12 of 2014 s.61)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: being present in a dedicated polling station situated in a maximum security prison. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services must not give consent under subsection (3)(h) if he has given consent under section 37(1A) to a polling agent of the same candidate. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (3)(h), the Commissioner of Correctional Services may, upon an application made under that subsection during the week before polling day, give consent under that subsection if he is satisfied that— (12 of 2014 s. 61)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector in custody who is entitled to vote at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison is admitted or transferred to the prison during that week; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application is made without undue delay after the admission or transfer. (L.N. 134 of 2009; 12 of 2014 s. 61)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.content: If the Commissioner of Correctional Services refuses to give consent under subsection (3)(h), he must notify the candidate or the election agent as soon as practicable. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

Subject to subsection (3), any act which purports to be done by an election agent in his capacity as such on behalf of the candidate who appointed him shall be as effective as if it had been done by the candidate in person.
A notice under section 25(1), 34(2) or (5), 42(4) or 55(3) given to the election agent of a candidate shall be regarded as having been given to the candidate.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Appointment of election expense agent

subsection.content: Each candidate may appoint any number of persons as his election expense agents.
Only a person who has attained the age of 18 years may be appointed as an election expense agent.
An election expense agent appointed by a candidate shall, by virtue of the appointment, be authorized to incur election expenses on behalf of the candidate as his agent.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Provisions applicable to appointment of agents

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: agent (代理人) means an election agent or election expense agent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to the Returning Officer shall be construed as a reference to the Returning Officer appointed for the Rural Area for which the candidate concerned is standing for election, or a reference to the Director of Home Affairs if the Returning Officer has not been appointed. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.content: An appointment of an agent is effected by giving a notice of appointment to the Returning Officer.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of appointment must— (12 of 2014 s. 62)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: be delivered to the Returning Officer by hand, by electronic mail, by facsimile transmission or (except a notice of an appointment made on polling day) by post; (12 of 2014 s. 62)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the name and the address of the agent;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: state—

subparagraph.content: for an election agent—the identity card number of the agent; and
for an election expense agent—the identity document number of the agent; and (1 of 2019 s. 85)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: be signed by the candidate and the agent.

subsection.content: The appointment of an agent may be revoked by giving a notice of revocation to the Returning Officer.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of revocation must be— (12 of 2014 s. 62)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: delivered to the Returning Officer by hand, by electronic mail, by facsimile transmission or (except a notice of revocation of appointment made on polling day) by post; and (12 of 2014 s. 62)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signed by the candidate.

subsection.content: If an agent dies or the appointment of an agent is revoked, the candidate may, subject to this Part, appoint another person as an agent to replace the first-mentioned agent.
The appointment of or revocation of the appointment of an agent is not effective until the notice of appointment or notice of revocation, as the case may be, is received by the Returning Officer.
The Returning Officer shall display a notice of the particulars of the election agents in a prominent place immediately outside his office.

subsection.leadIn: All notices of appointment of election expense agents given by any candidate under subsection (2) shall be made available for inspection by the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: free of charge;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at an office of the Returning Officer specified by him; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: during ordinary business hours,

subsection.continued: until the end of the period during which the copy of the election return lodged by the candidate is available for inspection under section 41 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554).

section.name: s25
section.heading: Other candidates to be notified of particulars of election agent

subsection.content: After receiving a notice of appointment of an election agent given by a candidate, the Returning Officer shall send a notice to every other candidate for the election concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the name and the address of the agent; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the name of the candidate who appoints the agent; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: be sent—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: (if the notice of appointment is received before the close of nominations) as soon as practicable after the close of nominations; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (in any other case) as soon as practicable after the receipt of the notice of appointment.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Limit of expenses for election expense agent

subsection.content: A candidate who appoints an election expense agent shall set the maximum amount of election expenses that the agent may incur on his behalf.
The amount set under subsection (1) by a candidate in relation to an election expense agent shall be specified in the notice of appointment of the agent.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Appointment of polling hours

subsection.content: The hours during which electors can cast their votes on the polling day shall be appointed by the Director of Home Affairs in accordance with this section.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Director of Home Affairs may appoint different polling hours for different Rural Areas and for different polling stations. (L.N. 134 of 2009; 5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services may assign a time slot during the polling hours appointed for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison to an elector in custody to whom the polling station is allocated under section 28A. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: Subject to section 46, an elector to whom a time slot is assigned under subsection (1B) may only cast his vote during the time slot. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services must, as early as practicable before the commencement of the poll, notify all electors to whom time slots are assigned under subsection (1B) of the time slot assigned to each of them. (L.N. 134 of 2009)
The Director of Home Affairs shall appoint the polling hours so as to give the electors a reasonable opportunity to vote.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services must assign the time slot so as to give the electors a reasonable opportunity to vote. (L.N. 134 of 2009)
The Director of Home Affairs shall, at least 10 days before the polling day, publish in the Gazette a notice specifying the polling hours for the Rural Area concerned. (5 of 2014 s. 2)
For the purposes of subsection (3), one notice may be published for more than one Rural Area. (5 of 2014 s. 2)
The Director of Home Affairs may, if he considers it appropriate to do so in the circumstances, extend the polling hours for any Rural Area or any polling station. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: If the Director of Home Affairs extends the polling hours under subsection (5), he shall give notice of the extension—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a public announcement made by radio or television; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by such other means as he considers appropriate in the circumstances.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Designation of polling stations, ballot paper sorting stations and counting stations

subsection.leadIn: The Director of Home Affairs shall designate, by notice published in the Gazette at least 10 days before polling day— (L.N. 134 of 2009; 12 of 2014 s. 103)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one or more places as a polling station or polling stations for conducting the poll for a Rural Area;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: one or more places as a ballot paper sorting station or ballot paper sorting stations for sorting ballot papers received from dedicated polling stations in the poll for a Rural Area in a rural ordinary election or, where the Director of Home Affairs considers appropriate, a rural by-election; and (L.N. 197 of 2009)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: one or more places as a counting station or counting stations for counting the votes cast at the polling station or polling stations used in the poll for a Rural Area. (L.N. 134 of 2009; 5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.content: The Director of Home Affairs may designate under subsection (1) the same place as a polling station and a counting station. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Director of Home Affairs must indicate in the notice any polling station which, in his or her opinion, is suitable for use for voting by persons with a disability. (12 of 2014 s. 103)

subsection.leadIn: The Director of Home Affairs may designate under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any premises occupied by a Government department for official purposes; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any structure, place or premises hired under subsection (3) or that is to be so hired; (L.N. 134 of 2009; L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any school in respect of which a grant is made out of the general revenue; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a building occupied by an organization, association or body in respect of which a grant is made out of the general revenue; or (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other structure, premises, whether permanent or temporary, mobile or otherwise, or place, that the Director considers suitable for a purpose specified in subsection (1). (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.content: The Director of Home Affairs may hire any structure, place or premises, or a part of a structure, place or premises, for use as a polling station or a counting station.

subsection.leadIn: The Director of Home Affairs shall, in the case of a polling station or a counting station which is not a Government building—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make good any damage caused; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: defray any expenses incurred by any person having control over the structure, place or premises,

subsection.continued: due to its having been used as a polling station or a counting station. (L.N. 134 of 2009 and L.N. 197 of 2009)

subsection.content: The Director of Home Affairs may take such steps as he considers appropriate, including taking out insurance, to insure against any risk of loss or damage that may arise due to or in connection with the use of any structure, place or premises as a polling station or a counting station.
A designation under subsection (1) may be made by reference to a map or plan.

subsection.leadIn: If a designation has been made by reference to a map or plan, the Director of Home Affairs shall display the relevant map or plan referred to in subsection (6)— (L.N. 134 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the relevant polling station is not a dedicated polling station, in a prominent place immediately outside the polling station;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the relevant polling station is a dedicated polling station, in a prominent place inside the polling station; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in a prominent place immediately outside the relevant counting station. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: The Director of Home Affairs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may make arrangements for polling for one or more than one Rural Area to take place at a polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make arrangements for counting the votes for one or more than one Rural Area cast at the polling station or all the polling stations used for polling for the Rural Area or each of the Rural Areas to take place at a counting station. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: The Director of Home Affairs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall allocate to each elector a polling station to cast his vote; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (in the case that an elector is entitled to vote in elections for more than one Rural Area) may allocate to such elector one polling station or more than one polling station to cast his votes. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.content: The Director of Home Affairs may, if he considers it appropriate to do so in the circumstances, allocate to an elector an alternative polling station, in addition to or in substitution of the polling station or any of the polling stations, as the case may be, allocated under subsection (9), to cast the vote or votes he is entitled to cast.
For the purposes of subsection (1), one notice may be published for more than one Rural Area. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

section.name: s28AA
section.heading: Director of Home Affairs may require certain premises for use as polling stations or counting stations

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 28(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d), the Director of Home Affairs may, by written notice, require an owner or occupier of any target premises to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow an authorized person to carry out a site visit at the premises for enabling the Director to determine whether the premises are suitable for use as a polling station or counting station in an election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Director considers the premises suitable—take the steps specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The steps specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to make available the premises for use as a polling station or counting station in the election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to allow an authorized person to carry out preparatory work and store materials at the premises for a purpose relating to such use.

subsection.content: If any target premises are used as a polling station or counting station as a result of a person’s compliance with a requirement made under subsection (1), the Director of Home Affairs must pay to the person a user fee for the period during which the premises are so used.

subsection.leadIn: The amount of the user fee payable under subsection (3) is to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: agreed between the person and the Director of Home Affairs; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no agreement can be reached—determined by the court by reference to the loss suffered by the person for making available the premises.

subsection.content: A user fee payable under subsection (3) is to be paid out of the general revenue.
A person who fails to comply with a requirement made under subsection (1) is liable to pay a financial penalty of $50,000, which is recoverable as a civil debt due to the Government.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) means a person authorized in writing by the Director of Home Affairs for the purposes of this section;

owner (業主), in relation to any target premises, means—(a)a person who appears from the records at the Land Registry to be the owner of—(i)the land on which the premises are situated; or(ii)if the land is divided into shares—an undivided share in the land that relates to the premises; and(b)a registered mortgagee in possession of such land or share;
target premises (目標處所) means a school or building described in section 28(2)(c) or (d) or any part of it.

section.name: s28A
section.heading: Allocation of polling stations to electors in custody

subsection.content: The Director of Home Affairs may allocate to each elector in custody a dedicated polling station to cast the vote he is entitled to cast at an election.

subsection.leadIn: To enable the Director of Home Affairs to perform his or her functions under this section in relation to electors, the Commissioner of Correctional Services must, upon a request by the Director of Home Affairs, provide the following information concerning every person who is serving a sentence of imprisonment or detained by the Correctional Services Department on remand—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the person’s identity document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prisoner registration number allocated by the Commissioner of Correctional Services to the person for identification purposes;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name and address of the premises in which the person is detained;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the date of birth of the person. (L.N. 77 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: To enable the Director of Home Affairs to perform his or her functions under this section in relation to electors, the head of any law enforcement agency must, upon a request by the Director of Home Affairs, provide the following information concerning every person who is detained by the law enforcement agency under any lawful authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the person’s identity document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name and address of the premises in which the person is detained;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date of birth of the person. (L.N. 77 of 2011)

section.name: s29
section.heading: Director of Home Affairs to send polling notices to electors

subsection.content: The Director of Home Affairs shall send a polling notice in the specified form to each elector.

subsection.leadIn: A polling notice shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date for holding the election for the Rural Area concerned;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the address of the polling station at which the elector must cast his vote for the Rural Area; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the polling hours;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a map showing the location of the polling station;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: detailed voting instructions; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the means by which information on the counting of the votes for the Rural Area may be obtained; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be sent at least 10 days before the polling day. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A polling notice sent to an elector who will be serving a sentence of imprisonment in a prison on the polling day must be addressed to the elector and sent, as far as practicable, to the prison. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

If an elector is entitled to vote in elections for more than one Rural Area, the Director of Home Affairs may send separate polling notices for each vote or send one polling notice for all the votes. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Where an alternative polling station is allocated to an elector under section 28(10), the Director of Home Affairs shall, as soon as practicable, notify, in such manner as he considers appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the elector;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer or the relevant Returning Officers;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the polling station previously allocated to the elector; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the alternative polling station.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Elector to vote at the correct polling station
section.content: An elector may only cast his vote for a Rural Area at the polling station allocated to him for the Rural Area under section 28(9) or (10), as the case may be.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Appointment of Presiding Officer and polling officers

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer shall, for each polling station used for polling for the Rural Area concerned, appoint— (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Presiding Officer to preside at the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such number of polling officers as he considers appropriate to assist the Presiding Officer in the conduct of a poll.

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer may designate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one polling officer appointed for a polling station as the Deputy Presiding Officer for the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any polling officer appointed for a polling station as an Assistant Presiding Officer for the polling station.

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall supply to the Presiding Officer a list of the names of the polling officers appointed for the polling station for which the Presiding Officer is appointed.

subsection.leadIn: If a polling station is used for polling for more than one Rural Area— (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appointment under subsection (1) and the designation under subsection (2) shall be made by the Returning Officers for those Rural Areas; and (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the list referred to in subsection (3) shall be supplied by one of those Returning Officers.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer shall display a list containing his name and the names of the polling officers appointed for the polling station in— (L.N. 77 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station) a prominent place immediately outside the station; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the polling station is a dedicated polling station) a prominent place inside the station. (L.N. 77 of 2011)

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer appointed for a polling station may perform any act that the Presiding Officer is required or authorized to perform under this Regulation through a polling officer, but the power to adjourn a poll under section 73(1) must be exercised by the Presiding Officer personally. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Copy of final register to be supplied to candidates and Returning Officer

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after a nomination form nominating a candidate is delivered to the Returning Officer, the Electoral Registration Officer shall supply to the candidate a copy of the final register for the Rural Area concerned. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

As soon as practicable after the publication of a notice under section 27(2) of the Election Ordinance, the Electoral Registration Officer shall supply to the Returning Officer a copy of the final register for the Rural Area concerned. (5 of 2014 s. 2)
The Electoral Registration Officer may add to the copy of the final register supplied under subsection (1) or (2) such particulars or information as that Officer considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: Copies of the final register may be supplied in any or all of the following forms—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a printed form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a non-legible form which is capable of being reproduced in a legible form by using a computer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other form determined by the Electoral Registration Officer.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Miscellaneous arrangements relating to voting

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall provide, at the polling station or at each polling station to be used for polling for the Rural Area concerned, sufficient compartments to enable electors to vote, screened from observation. (5 of 2014 ss. 2 & 43)

The Returning Officer shall supply to the Presiding Officer appointed for the polling station or each polling station to be used for polling for the Rural Area concerned such number of ballot papers as he considers necessary for the polling for the Rural Area. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer shall ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the name of any deceased or disqualified candidate for the Rural Area concerned regarding whom— (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a notice referred to in section 17(1) or 18(1) has been given; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: declarations referred to in section 17(3) or 18(3) have been made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other information relating to that candidate,

subsection.continued: if printed on the ballot papers, are crossed out. (1 of 2019 s. 43)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: If the name of, and other information relating to, a candidate (applicable candidate) on a ballot paper are crossed out under subsection (3), the Presiding Officer of the polling station at which the ballot paper is used for polling must ensure that a notice specified in subsection (3B) is displayed in a prominent place—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station—outside the polling station; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station—inside the polling station. (1 of 2019 s. 43)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: The notice must state that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicable candidate is—

subparagraph.content: a deceased candidate regarding whom a declaration referred to in section 17(3) has been made; or
a disqualified candidate regarding whom a declaration referred to in section 18(3) has been made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of, and other information relating to, the applicable candidate on the ballot paper are crossed out under subsection (3). (1 of 2019 s. 43)

subsection.content: The Director of Home Affairs shall provide at each polling station chops bearing a “✓” mark, with or without other design, that are necessary to enable electors to mark ballot papers.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer shall display a notice providing information on voting procedure for the guidance of electors—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a prominent place immediately outside a polling station which is not a dedicated polling station; (L.N. 134 of 2009)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: in a prominent place inside a dedicated polling station; and (L.N. 134 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inside every compartment provided under subsection (1).

section.name: s34
section.heading: Determination of no canvassing zone and no staying zone

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer shall, by reference to a map or plan, determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any area outside a polling station to be used for polling for the Rural Area concerned as a no canvassing zone; and (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any area within a no canvassing zone as a no staying zone.

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall give a notice indicating the boundaries of the no canvassing zone and the no staying zone to every candidate for election for the Rural Area at least 2 days before the polling day. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: If a polling station is to be used for polling for more than one Rural Area— (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the determination of the no canvassing zone and the no staying zone shall be made by the Returning Officer specified for the purpose by the Director of Home Affairs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that Officer shall give the notice under subsection (2) to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the candidates for election for the Rural Area for which that Officer is appointed; and

subparagraph.name: ii
