subparagraph.content: the Returning Officers for the other Rural Areas for which the polling station is used for polling, who shall, as soon as practicable after they receive the notice, give such notice to the candidates for election for their respective Rural Areas. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.content: The Returning Officer who makes a determination of a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone may vary the zone.

subsection.leadIn: If a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone is varied, the Returning Officer who varies the zone shall, as soon as practicable after the variation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a notice indicating the boundary of the zone as varied to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the candidates for election for the Rural Area for which that Officer is appointed; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (if the polling station is to be used for polling for more than one Rural Area) the Returning Officers for the other Rural Areas for which the polling station is used for polling, who shall, as soon as practicable after they receive the notice, give such notice to the candidates for election for their respective Rural Areas; and (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: display a copy of such notice at or near the polling station.

subsection.content: On the polling day, the Returning Officer who determines the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone (or subsequently varies it, where applicable) shall display at or near each polling station a notice indicating the boundaries of the no canvassing zone and the no staying zone as determined or, where applicable, as varied. (L.N. 134 of 2009)
A determination under subsection (1) comes into effect upon the display of a notice under subsection (6) in relation to the no canvassing zone and the no staying zone as determined.
A variation under subsection (4) comes into effect upon the display of a notice under subsection (6) in relation to the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone as varied.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Order at no canvassing zone and no staying zone

subsection.content: The Returning Officer and the Presiding Officer shall keep order at the no canvassing zone and the no staying zone.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (except as provided in subsection (3)) engage in canvassing for votes in a no canvassing zone;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2A), use a sound amplifying system or device for any purpose in a no canvassing zone without lawful authority or the express permission of the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer; (L.N. 77 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: use a sound amplifying system or device for canvassing for votes in such a manner that the sound emitted by it can be heard in a no canvassing zone;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: without reasonable excuse, display in a no canvassing zone any propaganda material relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any candidate or his candidate number;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body any member of which is standing as a candidate in the election concerned or a political body; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the election of Rural Representatives; or (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: stay or loiter in a no staying zone without the express permission of the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer,

subsection.continued: on the polling day.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: An officer of the Correctional Services Department may, on polling day, use a sound amplifying system or device for the performance of his or her duties in the no canvassing zone of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison. (L.N. 77 of 2011)

On the polling day, a person may, on the storeys above or below street level in a building within a no canvassing zone (other than a building in which there is a polling station), without obstructing any person, canvass for votes from door to door.
For the purposes of subsections (2) and (3), suggesting not to vote for any candidate shall be regarded as canvassing for votes.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall, in a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fail to comply with a lawful direction given by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cause an obstruction to any person who is in the zone and on his way to vote; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: otherwise misconduct himself,

subsection.continued: on the polling day.

subsection.leadIn: If a person contravenes subsection (2) or (5), the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the person to produce his identity document for inspection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: order the person to leave the relevant zone immediately.

subsection.content: No person shall fail to produce his identity document when required to do so under subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to leave when ordered to do so under subsection (6), he may be removed by— (L.N. 134 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a police officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer who ordered him to leave or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone, as may be appropriate, is determined in relation to a dedicated polling station, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.content: No person who is removed under subsection (8) shall enter the relevant zone again on the polling day without the express permission of the Returning Officer who ordered him to leave or the Presiding Officer.
The powers conferred by subsections (6) and (8) shall not be so exercised as to prevent an elector from voting.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Polling agents

subsection.content: A candidate may appoint a maximum of 2 polling agents for one polling station. (12 of 2014 s. 47)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Despite subsection (1) and subject to section 37(1A), (1B) and (6B), only one polling agent may be appointed by a candidate for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison. (12 of 2014 s. 47)

A polling agent appointed by a candidate may attend only at the polling station or polling stations on behalf of the candidate for a purpose connected with the conduct of a poll for the Rural Area concerned. (5 of 2014 s. 2)
Only a holder of an identity card, who has attained the age of 18 years, may be appointed as a polling agent.

subsection.leadIn: An appointment of a polling agent for a polling station other than a dedicated polling station situated in a prison is effective only if a notice of appointment is delivered to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission at least 7 days before polling day; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer by the candidate, or the election agent of the candidate, in person on polling day. (12 of 2014 s. 47)

subsection.leadIn: A notice of appointment shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be given by the candidate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the name, the identity card number and the address of the polling agent; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be signed by the candidate and the polling agent.

subsection.content: The appointment of a polling agent may be revoked by giving a notice of revocation to the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer of the polling station in accordance with subsection (7A) or (7B). (12 of 2014 s. 47)

subsection.leadIn: A notice of revocation shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: given by the candidate; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signed by the candidate.

subsection.name: 7A
subsection.content: If the notice of revocation is given before polling day, it must be delivered to the Returning Officer by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (12 of 2014 s. 47)

subsection.name: 7B
subsection.leadIn: If the notice of revocation is given on polling day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: (if the polling station for which the polling agent is appointed is not a dedicated polling station situated in a prison) it must be delivered to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Returning Officer by hand, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the polling station by the candidate, or the election agent of the candidate, in person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the polling station for which the polling agent is appointed is a dedicated polling station situated in a prison) it must be delivered to the Returning Officer by hand, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (12 of 2014 s. 47)

subsection.content: If a polling agent dies or the appointment of a polling agent is revoked, the candidate may, subject to this section, appoint another person as a polling agent to replace the first-mentioned agent.

The appointment of or revocation of the appointment of a polling agent is not effective until the notice of appointment or notice of revocation, as the case may be, is received by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Admission to polling station

subsection.leadIn: No person may enter or stay in a polling station, except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director of Home Affairs;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an Assistant Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer appointed for the polling station;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a polling officer appointed for the polling station;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an elector;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: (subject to subsections (3) and (8)) a candidate;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: (subject to subsections (3), (4), (5), (6B) and (8) and section 22(3)) an election agent; (L.N. 134 of 2009 and L.N. 197 of 2009; L.N. 77 of 2011)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: (subject to subsections (1A), (3), (4), (6), (6B) and (8)) a polling agent; (L.N. 134 of 2009; L.N. 77 of 2011)

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: a public officer on duty at the polling station;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: a member of the Civil Aid Service on duty at the polling station;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: a child accompanying an elector who comes to the polling station for the purpose of voting; or

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: a person authorized under subsection (9).

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: A polling agent may not be present in a dedicated polling station situated in a prison unless— (12 of 2014 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of appointment is given at least 7 days before polling day and delivered to the Director of Home Affairs by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner of Correctional Services consents to the appointment. (L.N. 134 of 2009; 12 of 2014 s. 48)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services must not give consent under subsection (1A) if he has given consent under section 22(3)(h) to the election agent of the same candidate. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1A), even though a notice of appointment is given during the week before polling day, the Commissioner of Correctional Services may still give consent under that subsection if the Commissioner is satisfied that— (12 of 2014 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector in custody who is entitled to vote at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison is admitted or transferred to the prison during that week; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the notice of appointment is given without undue delay after the admission or transfer. (L.N. 134 of 2009; 12 of 2014 s. 48)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: If the Commissioner of Correctional Services refuses to give consent under subsection (1A), the Commissioner must notify the candidate or the election agent of the candidate as soon as practicable. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: In order to ensure that polling takes place smoothly and efficiently, the Presiding Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may regulate the number of electors, candidates, election agents and polling agents to be admitted to the polling station concerned at any one time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, subject to subsection (1), exclude any person from the polling station concerned.

subsection.content: A candidate, an election agent or a polling agent may be present in a polling station subject to the availability of seats in the area designated to accommodate them.
Only an election agent or a polling agent regarding whom a notice of appointment has been given under this Regulation may be present in a polling station on behalf of a candidate.
If a candidate is present in a polling station, the election agent of that candidate may not be present in the polling station at the same time.
Only one polling agent of a candidate may be present in a polling station, on behalf of the candidate, at any one time, if neither the candidate nor the election agent is present.

subsection.name: 6B
subsection.content: No election agent or polling agent may be present in a dedicated polling station situated in a maximum security prison. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: A candidate, an election agent or a polling agent who wishes to be admitted to a polling station shall, on arriving at the polling station—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: report in person to the Presiding Officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: produce—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: his identity document; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a declaration of secrecy, in the specified form, completed by him.

subsection.leadIn: If the area referred to in subsection (3) is occupied to its full seating capacity, the Presiding Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may refuse entry to the polling station to any candidate, election agent or polling agent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make arrangements for admitting such candidate, election agent or polling agent to the polling station later.

subsection.content: The Returning Officer or a member of the Commission may authorize any person in writing to enter and stay in a polling station in accordance with the terms of the authorization.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Order at polling station

subsection.content: The Returning Officer and the Presiding Officer shall keep order at the polling station concerned.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: communicate with any elector; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use a mobile telephone, paging machine or any other communication device to communicate with any other person,

subsection.continued: in a polling station during the polling hours appointed for it contrary to a direction of the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer not to do so. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director of Home Affairs;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an Assistant Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a Presiding Officer appointed for the polling station; (L.N. 134 of 2009)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a polling officer appointed for the polling station;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a public officer on duty at the polling station;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a member of the Civil Aid Service on duty at the polling station; or

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a person authorized by the Returning Officer or a member of the Commission in writing to do an act prohibited by subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: film;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take a photograph; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make any audio or video recording,

subsection.continued: in a polling station on the polling day without the express permission of a member of the Commission, the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: engage in canvassing for votes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: without reasonable excuse, display any propaganda material relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any candidate or his candidate number;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body any member of which is standing as a candidate in the election concerned or a political body; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the election of Rural Representatives, (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.continued: in a polling station on the polling day.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (5), suggesting not to vote for any candidate shall be regarded as canvassing for votes.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall, in a polling station or its vicinity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fail to comply with a lawful direction given by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disrupt the poll;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: disturb or cause inconvenience to any person except in the execution of his duty; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: otherwise misconduct himself,

subsection.continued: on the polling day.

subsection.leadIn: If a person contravenes subsection (5) or (7), the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the person to produce his identity document for inspection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: order the person to leave the polling station or its vicinity, as the case may be, immediately.

subsection.content: No person shall fail to produce his identity document when required to do so under subsection (8).

subsection.name: 9A
subsection.content: If an elector who is allocated to vote at a dedicated polling station fails to cast his vote without undue delay in accordance with section 47(6), the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer may order him to leave the polling station immediately. (L.N. 134 of 2009; 5 of 2014 s. 44)

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to leave when ordered to do so under subsection (8) or (9A), the person may be removed— (L.N. 134 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station, by a police officer or by a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer who ordered the person to leave or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer who ordered the person to leave or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an officer of the Correctional Services Department; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an officer of any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.content: No person who is removed under subsection (10) shall enter the polling station or its vicinity again on the polling day without the express permission of the Returning Officer who ordered him to leave or the Presiding Officer.
The powers conferred by subsections (8) and (10) shall not be so exercised as to prevent an elector from voting.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Ballot Boxes, Ballot Papers and Voting Procedure

section.name: s39
section.heading: Design of ballot box
section.content: A ballot box to be used in a poll shall be so constructed that ballot papers can be put into it while it is locked but cannot be withdrawn from it without unlocking it and breaking the sealing device used to seal it.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Ballot box to be sealed before commencement of poll

subsection.content: Immediately before the commencement of the poll, the Presiding Officer shall show the ballot box or each ballot box, empty, to the persons who are present in the polling station concerned.

The Presiding Officer shall, after showing a ballot box under subsection (1), lock it and seal it with a sealing device provided for that purpose by the Director of Home Affairs so that it cannot be opened without unlocking the lock and breaking the sealing device.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: place the ballot box or each ballot box for the receipt of ballot papers in the view of a polling officer or himself; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that the ballot box or each ballot box is kept locked and sealed while it is in his custody.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Form of ballot papers

subsection.content: A ballot paper to be used for an election for an Existing Village shall be in Form 1 set out in Schedule 1.

subsection.leadIn: A ballot paper to be used for an election for an Indigenous Village shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (where there is one vacancy) in Form 2(a) set out in Schedule 1; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where there is more than one vacancy) in Form 2(b) set out in Schedule 1.

subsection.content: A ballot paper to be used for an election for a Composite Indigenous Village shall be in Form 3 set out in Schedule 1.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: A ballot paper to be used for an election for a Market Town is to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if there is more than one vacancy—in Form 4(a) set out in Schedule 1; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is one vacancy—in Form 4(b) set out in Schedule 1. (5 of 2014 s. 45)

subsection.leadIn: The Director of Home Affairs may decide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the colour and the design of a ballot paper; and (5 of 2014 s. 45)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the ballot papers to be used for the elections for different Rural Areas are to be printed in different colours and to have different designs. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.content: A number may be printed on the counterfoil of a ballot paper, but that number shall not be printed or shown in any manner on the ballot paper.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Order of names of candidates on ballot papers

subsection.content: A number shall be allocated to each candidate by the drawing of lots conducted by the Returning Officer.
The names of the candidates shall appear on a ballot paper in the order of the numbers allocated under subsection (1).
The number allocated to a candidate shall be printed on a ballot paper against his name.
The Returning Officer shall give notice to each candidate of the arrangements for the drawing of lots under subsection (1).
A candidate or his election agent may be present at the drawing of lots under subsection (1).

section.name: s42A
section.heading: Arrangement for giving ballot papers to elderly persons, pregnant women, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer may designate an area in the polling station for giving a ballot paper to a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is not less than 70 years of age;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whose document specified in section 45(2A)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f) shows the year of birth, without the month and day of birth, of the person which is 70 years earlier than the year within which the polling day falls;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: whose document specified in section 45(2A)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f) shows, without the day of birth—

subparagraph.content: the year of birth of the person which is 70 years earlier than the year within which the polling day falls; and
the month of birth of the person which is the same as the month within which the polling day falls;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: who is pregnant; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: who, because of illness, injury, disability or dependence on mobility aids—

subparagraph.content: is not able to queue for a long time; or
has difficulty in queuing.

subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer is satisfied that a person who arrives at, or is present in, the polling station to vote falls within the description in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e), the Officer may direct the person to immediately proceed to the following location to apply for a ballot paper—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the area designated under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is a queue extending from that area—the end of the queue.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Question to person applying for a ballot paper

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer may, in case of doubt and at the time a person applies for a ballot paper, ask the person any appropriate questions set out in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The questions referred to in subsection (1) are—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: “你是否已登記在本鄉郊地區 (the Presiding Officer to read the name and the type of the Rural Area) 的正式選民登記冊上，而有關登記記項一如以下所述 (the Presiding Officer to read the whole entry as it is recorded in the final register)?”; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: “Are you the person registered in the final register for this Rural Area (the Presiding Officer to read the name and the type of the Rural Area), as follows (the Presiding Officer to read the whole entry as it is recorded in the final register)?”; (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: “你是否已在本鄉郊地區 (the Presiding Officer to read the name and type of the Rural Area) 的鄉郊代表 (the Presiding Officer to read the type of the Rural Representative) 選舉中投了票？”; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: “Have you already voted in this election to elect a Rural Representative (the Presiding Officer to read the type of the Rural Representative) for this Rural Area (the Presiding Officer to read the name and type of the Rural Area)?”. (5 of 2014 s. 46)

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer must ask the appropriate questions set out in subsection (2) if so required by a candidate, an election agent or a polling agent.
The Presiding Officer shall not issue a ballot paper to any person who fails to answer the questions asked of that person under this section to the satisfaction of that Officer.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Challenging a person who has applied for a ballot paper or who has voted

subsection.leadIn: If a candidate, an election agent or a polling agent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: declares to the Presiding Officer that he has reasonable cause to believe that a person has engaged in corrupt conduct of impersonation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: undertakes in writing to substantiate the allegation in a court,

subsection.continued: the Presiding Officer may take the step specified in subsection (3A).

subsection.leadIn: A declaration referred to in subsection (1) may only be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time the person applies for a ballot paper; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after the person has applied for a ballot paper but before the person has left the polling station.

subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer has reason to believe that a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: applying for a ballot paper; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who has applied for a ballot paper and has not left the polling station,

subsection.continued: has engaged in corrupt conduct of impersonation, the Presiding Officer may take the step specified in subsection (3A).

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: The step specified for the purposes of subsections (1) and (3) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station, requesting a police officer to arrest the person concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, requesting an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency to remove the person concerned from the polling station and report the case to the police. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: A person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of whom a declaration is made under subsection (1) (whether or not he is arrested or removed under that subsection); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who has been arrested or removed pursuant to a request made under subsection (3),

subsection.continued: shall not be prevented from voting only by reason of the declaration, arrest or removal. (L.N. 77 of 2011)

subsection.def: In this section, corrupt conduct of impersonation (冒充別人的舞弊行為) means the corrupt conduct referred to in section 15 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554).

section.name: s45
section.heading: Issue of ballot paper

subsection.leadIn: If, at a polling station used for polling for only one Rural Area, a person applies for a ballot paper at the issuing desk, the polling officer manning the desk shall, upon being satisfied, by inspecting the document or documents set out in subsection (2A) or (2B), that the person is an elector registered in the final register for the Rural Area, issue to the person— (5 of 2014 s. 2; L.N. 133 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one ballot paper to be used for the election for the Rural Area; and (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a chop provided under section 33(4) for marking the ballot paper.

subsection.leadIn: If, at a polling station used for polling for more than one Rural Area, a person applies for a ballot paper at the issuing desk, the polling officer manning the desk shall, upon being satisfied, by inspecting the document or documents set out in subsection (2A) or (2B), that— (5 of 2014 s. 2; L.N. 133 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person is an elector registered in the final register for one of the Rural Areas for which the polling station is used for polling, issue to the person— (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one ballot paper to be used for the election for that Rural Area; and (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a chop provided under section 33(4) for marking the ballot paper; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person is an elector registered in the final registers for more than one Rural Area for which the polling station is used for polling, issue to the person— (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (3), one ballot paper to be used for the election for each of those Rural Areas; and (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a chop provided under section 33(4) for marking those ballot papers.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: For a person applying for a ballot paper at a polling station (other than a dedicated polling station situated in a prison), the document or documents referred to in subsections (1) and (2) are any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s identity document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a document issued by the Commissioner (within the meaning of section 1A(1) of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177)) acknowledging that the person has applied— (L.N. 152 of 2018)

subparagraph.content: to be registered under that Ordinance; or (L.N. 152 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: a valid identity book for a seaman issued to the person under regulation 3 of the Immigration Regulations (Cap. 115 sub. leg. A);

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.leadIn: both— (L.N. 152 of 2018)

subparagraph.content: a document evidencing a report to a police officer of the loss or destruction of the document referred to in paragraph (a) or (b); and (L.N. 152 of 2018)

a valid passport or similar travel document (not being one referred to in another paragraph in this subsection) issued to the person showing the person’s name and photograph. (L.N. 133 of 2017; L.N. 152 of 2018)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: For a person applying for a ballot paper at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison, the document referred to in subsections (1) and (2) is a document issued by the Commissioner of Correctional Services showing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s photograph; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prisoner registration number allocated by that Commissioner to the person for identification purposes. (L.N. 133 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: If a person referred to in subsection (2)(b) does not wish to cast all the votes which he is entitled to cast for the Rural Areas for which the polling station is used for polling or he does not wish to do so at the same time, he— (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be issued, upon his application, one ballot paper to be used for the election for the Rural Area for which he is going to cast his vote; and (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may cast his remaining vote later, before the close of the poll (whether he has left and subsequently returns to the polling station or he has not left the polling station).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1), (2) and (3), where the person is an elector registered in a final register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an Existing Village, the person must be issued a ballot paper to be used for an election for an Existing Village; (5 of 2014 s. 47)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an Indigenous Village, the person must be issued a ballot paper to be used for an election for an Indigenous Village; (5 of 2014 s. 47)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a Composite Indigenous Village, the person must be issued a ballot paper to be used for an election for a Composite Indigenous Village; or (5 of 2014 s. 47)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a Market Town, the person must be issued a ballot paper to be used for an election for a Market Town. (5 of 2014 s. 47)

subsection.content: Before a ballot paper or ballot papers are issued to an elector, the polling officer shall call out the name of the elector as stated in the copy of the relevant final register or registers in that officer’s possession.

To ensure that the correct ballot paper or ballot papers are issued to an elector, the polling officer may require the elector to verify the entry relating to him in the relevant final register or registers.

A person shall not be prevented from voting only because of an omission or inaccuracy of a particular required to be registered in the relevant final register, other than the omission of his name and, where applicable, his principal residential address.

subsection.leadIn: Immediately before issuing a ballot paper or ballot papers to an elector, the polling officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if a printed copy of the relevant final register or registers is used to record the issue, do either or both of the following—

subparagraph.content: marking the copy in that officer’s possession by placing a line across the name and identity document number of the elector;
marking the copy in that officer’s possession in any other way directed by the Director of Home Affairs; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an FR electronic copy or extract (as defined by section 96) of the relevant final register or registers is used to record the issue—make, by using an electronic device, a record in the entry relating to the elector in the FR electronic copy or extract,

subsection.continued: to denote that the ballot paper or ballot papers the elector is entitled to have issued to him or her at the relevant polling station has been or have been so issued. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.content: No record shall be made of the particular ballot paper or ballot papers issued to an elector.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Elector who has not cast vote may return to cast vote with permission

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector has been issued with a ballot paper or ballot papers; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (except in the case under section 45(3)) he has left the polling station without casting his vote or any of his votes,

subsection.continued: he shall not cast the vote or votes when he returns to the polling station before the close of the poll unless—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: before leaving the polling station, he has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: made a request to the Presiding Officer for permission to cast the vote or votes before the close of the poll;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: informed the Presiding Officer of his reason for leaving the polling station without casting the vote or votes; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: returned the ballot paper or ballot papers, unmarked, to the Presiding Officer; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer has granted the requested permission.

subsection.content: If an elector has complied with subsection (1)(c), the Presiding Officer shall grant the permission unless he is of the opinion that the request is a manifest abuse of the facilities provided by this section.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Despite subsections (1) and (2), an elector to whom a permission is granted under subsection (1) by a Presiding Officer of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison must not cast the vote unless the elector returns to the polling station within the time slot assigned to him under subsection (2B) or section 27(1B). (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison grants the permission to an elector under subsection (1), the Commissioner of Correctional Services must, as far as practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assign to the elector a new time slot during the polling hours appointed for the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the elector of the new time slot. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer grants the permission to an elector under subsection (2), he shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep in his custody the ballot paper or ballot papers returned by the elector under subsection (1)(c)(iii); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the elector’s return to the polling station before the close of the poll to cast the vote or votes, re-issue the ballot paper or ballot papers to the elector in the presence of— (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station, a police officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.content: If the Presiding Officer does not grant the permission to an elector under subsection (2), he shall immediately re-issue to the elector the ballot paper or ballot papers returned under subsection (1)(c)(iii).

subsection.leadIn: An elector who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been issued with a ballot paper or ballot papers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: becomes incapacitated from voting by physical illness; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: has left the polling station after—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: returning the ballot paper or ballot papers, unmarked, to the Presiding Officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: leaving the ballot paper or ballot papers, unmarked, behind in the polling station without putting the ballot paper or ballot papers into the ballot box or ballot boxes (if the Presiding Officer is aware that the elector has so left the ballot paper or ballot papers behind before leaving the polling station),

subsection.continued: may return to the polling station before the close of the poll and cast his vote or votes.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: If an elector in custody leaves a dedicated polling station situated in a prison under subsection (5), the Commissioner of Correctional Services must, as far as practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assign to the elector a new time slot during the polling hours appointed for the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the elector of the new time slot. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.content: The right of an elector in custody who is allocated to vote at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison to cast the vote under subsection (5) is subject to his returning to the dedicated polling station within the time slot assigned to him under subsection (5A) or section 27(1B). (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If any ballot paper is returned under subsection (5)(c)(i) or left behind in the polling station under subsection (5)(c)(ii) by an elector, the Presiding Officer shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep in his custody the ballot paper; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the elector’s return to the polling station before the close of the poll to cast the vote, re-issue the ballot paper to the elector in the presence of— (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station, a police officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Regulation, re-issuing a ballot paper under subsection (3), (4) or (6) shall be regarded as issuing a ballot paper under section 45(1), (2) or (3), as the case may be.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Voting procedure

subsection.content: Subject to section 49(1), when an elector is issued with a ballot paper or ballot papers, he or she must immediately go into a voting compartment and mark the ballot paper or ballot papers. (5 of 2014 s. 48)

subsection.leadIn: An elector must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when being issued with a ballot paper or ballot papers, be provided with a cardboard in a colour determined by the Director of Home Affairs so as to indicate the number of ballot papers issued to the elector; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry with him or her the cardboard before it is returned under subsection (6)(b). (5 of 2014 s. 48)

subsection.leadIn: After marking the ballot paper or ballot papers, the elector must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before leaving the voting compartment, conceal the mark on it or the marks on them;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: put the ballot paper or ballot papers into the correct ballot box; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: follow any direction (if appropriate) given by the Director of Home Affairs under subsection (4). (5 of 2014 s. 48)

subsection.leadIn: The Director of Home Affairs may direct, in such manner as he or she thinks fit, an elector to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fold the ballot paper so that the marked side is inside and put the folded ballot paper into the correct ballot box;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: put the ballot paper, unfolded, into an envelope provided at the polling station and put the ballot paper contained in the envelope into the correct ballot box;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fold the ballot paper so that the marked side is inside, put the folded ballot paper into an envelope provided at the polling station and put the ballot paper contained in the envelope into the correct ballot box; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: put the ballot paper, unfolded, into the correct ballot box with the marked side facing down. (5 of 2014 s. 48)

subsection.content: If an elector is issued with more than one ballot papers, the Director of Home Affairs may give separate directions under subsection (4) for each ballot paper. (5 of 2014 s. 48)

subsection.leadIn: An elector must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cast his or her vote without undue delay;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: return to any polling officer in the polling station the chop issued under section 45 and the cardboard provided under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: leave the polling station as soon as he or she has put the ballot paper or ballot papers into the ballot box or ballot boxes and returned the chop and cardboard. (5 of 2014 s. 48)

subsection.content: A person must not put anything into the ballot box other than a marked ballot paper or an envelope referred to in subsection (4). (5 of 2014 s. 48)
Except where it is provided otherwise in this Regulation, a person must not remove a ballot paper from a polling station. (5 of 2014 s. 48)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: voting compartment (劃票間) means a compartment provided under section 33(1). (5 of 2014 s. 48)

section.name: s48
section.heading: How ballot papers are to be marked

subsection.leadIn: An elector voting for an Existing Village—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may vote for only one candidate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall mark his ballot paper by affixing the chop issued under section 45 to give a single “✓” in the circle opposite the name of the candidate of his choice on the ballot paper.

subsection.leadIn: An elector voting for an Indigenous Village—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may vote for a number of candidates not exceeding the number of Indigenous Inhabitant Representatives to be returned for the Village at the election concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall mark his ballot paper by affixing the chop issued under section 45 to give a single “✓” in each of the circles opposite the names of the candidates of his choice on the ballot paper. (5 of 2014 s. 49)

subsection.leadIn: An elector voting for a Composite Indigenous Village—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may vote for only one candidate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall mark his ballot paper by affixing the chop issued under section 45 to give a single “✓” in the circle opposite the name of the candidate of his choice on the ballot paper.

subsection.leadIn: An elector voting for a Market Town—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may vote for a number of candidates not exceeding the number of Kaifong Representatives to be returned for the Market Town at the election concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must mark his or her ballot paper by affixing the chop issued under section 45 to give a single “✓” in each of the circles opposite the names of the candidates of his or her choice on the ballot paper. (5 of 2014 s. 49)

section.name: s49
section.heading: Marking of ballot paper for or by incapacitated person

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer, the Deputy Presiding Officer or any Assistant Presiding Officer may, upon the request of an elector who claims that he is unable to read or is incapacitated from casting his vote because of impaired eyesight or other physical cause—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: mark a ballot paper, in a compartment provided under section 33(1) in the polling station, for the elector according to the choice of the elector in the manner specified in section 48(1), (2), (3) or (4), as the case may be; and (5 of 2014 s. 50)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: conceal the mark on the ballot paper before leaving the compartment and put the ballot paper into the correct ballot box, (5 of 2014 s. 50)

subsection.continued: in the presence of a polling officer designated by the Presiding Officer, the Deputy Presiding Officer or the Assistant Presiding Officer, as the case may be, having regard to the choice (if any) of a candidate or his polling agent.

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer shall cause a template to be made available upon request by an elector.
A template made available to an elector under subsection (2) shall be so constructed as to be able to facilitate the marking of a ballot paper by an elector suffering from impaired eyesight.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Issue of ballot paper marked “TENDERED”

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2) and sections 45(3) and 46, if a person (the first-mentioned person) representing himself to be a particular elector applies for a ballot paper for a particular Rural Area after a ballot paper for the Rural Area had already been issued on the basis that the person to whom it was issued was that elector, the Presiding Officer shall issue to the first-mentioned person a ballot paper for the Rural Area endorsed on the front of it with the words “TENDERED” and “重複”.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer may issue a ballot paper under subsection (1) only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is not certain that the first-mentioned person is the person who had been issued with a ballot paper for the Rural Area earlier; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the first-mentioned person answers the appropriate questions set out in section 43(2) to his satisfaction.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Marking “UNUSED” on ballot paper
section.leadIn: The Presiding Officer must, as far as reasonably practicable, endorse the words “UNUSED” and “未用” on a ballot paper that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been issued; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been put into a ballot box.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Marking “SPOILT” on ballot paper

subsection.leadIn: If an elector issued with a ballot paper—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inadvertently deals with it in such a manner that it cannot be properly used as a ballot paper; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes an error in marking it,

subsection.continued: he may apply to the Presiding Officer for another ballot paper.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer may issue another ballot paper to an elector referred to in subsection (1) if the elector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: returns the ballot paper already issued to him to the Presiding Officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: establishes to the satisfaction of the Presiding Officer the circumstances referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b).

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer shall immediately cancel a ballot paper returned to him under subsection (2) by endorsing the words “SPOILT” and “損壞” on the front of the ballot paper and keep it in his custody.
For the purposes of this Regulation, issuing a ballot paper under subsection (2) shall be regarded as issuing a ballot paper under section 45(1), (2) or (3), as the case may be.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Steps to be taken at polling station after close of poll: polling station that is also counting station

subsection.content: This section applies if a polling station is also designated as a counting station at an election.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after the close of the poll at the polling station, the Presiding Officer of the station must display a notice in a prominent place outside the station stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the poll has been closed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the station will be opened as a counting station when it is ready for use for the counting of the votes.

subsection.content: A candidate and the candidate’s election agent, polling agent and counting agent may stay in the polling station while it is closed for preparation for the counting of the votes.

subsection.leadIn: After complying with subsection (2), the Presiding Officer must, in the presence of the persons who are present in the polling station—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: seal the ballot box or each ballot box with a sealing device provided for that purpose by the Director of Home Affairs so that nothing can be put into or withdrawn from the box after it is sealed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: make up into separate sealed packets—

subparagraph.content: the counterfoils of the ballot papers that have been issued;
the ballot papers that have not been issued;
the unused ballot papers;
the spoilt ballot papers; and
if the copy of the relevant final register or registers has been marked under section 45(8)(a)—the marked copy.

subsection.content: For subsection (4)(b), if the polling station is used for polling for more than one Rural Area, the Presiding Officer must make separate sealed packets for each Rural Area.

subsection.leadIn: All the items specified in subsection (7) must then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Presiding Officer is to preside at the counting station—be kept under the Officer’s control until the counting of the votes begins; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a Returning Officer is to preside at the counting station—be handed over by the Presiding Officer as soon as practicable to the Returning Officer and be kept under the Returning Officer’s control until the counting of the votes begins.

subsection.leadIn: The items specified for the purposes of subsection (6) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sealed ballot box or boxes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sealed packets; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ballot paper account or accounts prepared by the Presiding Officer.

section.name: s53A
section.heading: Steps to be taken at polling station after close of poll: polling station that is not counting station

subsection.content: This section applies if a polling station is not also designated as a counting station at an election.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after the close of the poll at the polling station, the Presiding Officer of the station must display a notice in a prominent place outside the station stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the poll has been closed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the name and location of—

subparagraph.content: if applicable, the ballot paper sorting station for sorting the ballot papers received from that polling station (relevant sorting station); and
the counting station for counting the votes cast at that polling station (relevant counting station).

subsection.leadIn: After complying with subsection (2), the Presiding Officer must, in the presence of the persons who are present in the polling station—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: seal the ballot box or each ballot box with a sealing device provided for that purpose by the Director of Home Affairs so that nothing can be put into or withdrawn from the box after it is sealed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: make up into separate sealed packets—

subparagraph.content: the counterfoils of the ballot papers that have been issued;
the ballot papers that have not been issued;
the unused ballot papers;
the spoilt ballot papers; and
if the copy of the relevant final register or registers has been marked under section 45(8)(a)—the marked copy.

subsection.content: For subsection (3)(b), if the polling station is used for polling for more than one Rural Area, the Presiding Officer must make separate sealed packets for each Rural Area.
A candidate and the candidate’s election agent and polling agent may stay in the polling station while it is closed for taking the steps described in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: If the polling station is not a dedicated polling station, the Presiding Officer must then, as soon as practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deliver all the items specified in subsection (8) to the relevant counting station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hand over the items to the Officer-in-charge of the relevant counting station.

subsection.leadIn: If the polling station is a dedicated polling station, the Presiding Officer must then, as soon as practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deliver all the items specified in subsection (8) to the relevant sorting station, or the relevant counting station, as advised by the Director of Home Affairs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hand over the items to the Officer-in-charge of the relevant sorting station or relevant counting station.

subsection.leadIn: The items specified for the purposes of subsections (6) and (7) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sealed ballot box or boxes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sealed packets; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ballot paper account or accounts prepared by the Presiding Officer.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Ballot paper account

subsection.def: The Presiding Officer (other than the Presiding Officer of a dedicated polling station) shall prepare a statement (ballot paper account) which complies with subsection (2) and, at a polling station used for polling for more than one Rural Area, prepare a separate ballot paper account for each Rural Area. (L.N. 77 of 2011; 5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: The ballot paper account prepared under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: show the number of ballot papers supplied under section 33(2) for the Rural Area concerned (stating whether they are ballot papers to be used for an election for an Existing Village, an Indigenous Village, a Composite Indigenous Village or a Market Town) and account for those ballot papers under the following heads— (5 of 2014 ss. 2 & 51)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the number of ballot papers estimated by the Presiding Officer to be in the ballot box or ballot boxes;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the number of ballot papers which have not been issued;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the number of unused ballot papers; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the number of spoilt ballot papers.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer of a dedicated polling station must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (if one or more ballot papers have been issued by the Presiding Officer on the polling day) prepare a statement which complies with subsection (4) for each Rural Area in respect of which ballot papers have been issued; or (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no ballot paper has been issued by the Presiding Officer on the polling day) prepare a statement in the specified form confirming that no ballot paper has been issued by the Presiding Officer on the polling day. (L.N. 77 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: The statement prepared under subsection (3)(a) must be in the specified form and show the number of ballot papers for the Rural Area supplied to the Presiding Officer under section 33(2) and account for those ballot papers under the following heads— (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of ballot papers estimated by the Presiding Officer to be in the ballot box or boxes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of un-issued ballot papers;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of unused ballot papers;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the number of spoilt ballot papers. (L.N. 77 of 2011)

section.name: s55
section.heading: Determination and notice of time of counting of votes

subsection.content: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station is to determine the time at which the counting of the votes at the station is to begin. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

The time determined under subsection (1) must be a time after the poll has closed at all the polling stations at which polling for the Rural Area concerned was conducted. (L.N. 134 of 2009; 5 of 2014 s. 2; L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2), the time determined under subsection (1) in respect of sorting ballot papers at a ballot paper sorting station—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be a time after the poll has closed at all the dedicated polling stations situated in prisons at which polling for the Rural Area concerned was conducted; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be a time before the poll has closed at all the other polling stations at which polling for the Rural Area concerned is conducted. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.content: The Returning Officer must give written notice to each candidate of the addresses of the counting stations at which the counting of the votes for the Rural Area is to take place. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3) shall be given—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: (in any other case) at least 10 days before polling day. (12 of 2014 s. 104)

subsection.content: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station must, before the counting of the votes begins, display a notice in a prominent place outside the station stating the time that the station will be opened to the public to observe the counting of the votes. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s56
section.heading: Appointment of counting agent

subsection.content: A candidate may appoint counting agents to attend at a counting station (relevant counting station) to observe the counting of the votes for the Rural Area for which the candidate is standing for election. (5 of 2014 s. 2; L.N. 163 of 2021)
The Returning Officer shall determine the maximum number of counting agents a candidate may appoint.
Only a holder of an identity card, who has attained the age of 18 years, may be appointed as a counting agent.

subsection.leadIn: An appointment of a counting agent is effective only if a notice of appointment is delivered— (12 of 2014 s. 49; L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the Returning Officer by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission before the 3 days preceding polling day; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the Officer-in-charge of the relevant counting station by the candidate, or the election agent of the candidate, in person on polling day. (12 of 2014 s. 49; L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: A notice of appointment shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be given by the candidate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the name, the identity card number and the address of the counting agent; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be signed by the candidate and the counting agent.

subsection.leadIn: The appointment of a counting agent may be revoked in the following way—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the poll has not yet closed—

subparagraph.content: delivering a notice of revocation to the Returning Officer by hand, by electronic mail, by facsimile transmission or (except a notice of revocation made on the polling day) by post; or
the candidate or the candidate’s election agent delivering a notice of revocation in person to the Officer-in-charge of the relevant counting station; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the poll has closed—the candidate or the candidate’s election agent delivering a notice of revocation in person to the Officer-in-charge of the relevant counting station. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: A notice of revocation shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: given by the candidate; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signed by the candidate.

subsection.content: If a counting agent dies or the appointment of a counting agent is revoked, the candidate may, subject to this section, appoint another person as a counting agent to replace the first-mentioned agent.

The appointment of or revocation of the appointment of a counting agent is not effective until the notice of appointment or notice of revocation, as the case may be, is received by the Returning Officer or by the Officer-in-charge of the relevant counting station, as may be appropriate. (12 of 2014 s. 49; L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s57
section.heading: Appointment of Assistant Returning Officer, Presiding Officer and counting officers

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Electoral Affairs Commission may appoint an Assistant Returning Officer to preside at a ballot paper sorting station. (L.N. 134 of 2009)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: The Director of Home Affairs may appoint a person who is appointed as the Presiding Officer for a polling station under section 31(1)(a) as the Presiding Officer for the counting station for counting the votes cast at that polling station. (L.N. 163 of 2021)
The Director of Home Affairs may appoint a number of counting officers the Director considers appropriate for a counting station to assist the Officer-in-charge of the station in counting the votes.
The Officer-in-charge of a counting station must display a list of the names of the counting officers in a prominent place within the counting station.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Admission to counting station

subsection.content: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station may set apart an area within the station as a counting zone. (L.N. 163 of 2021)
Where a counting zone is set apart under subsection (1), the zone must be delineated and identified by the means the Officer-in-charge considers appropriate. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: No person may enter or stay in a counting zone, except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director of Home Affairs;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an Assistant Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the counting station; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a counting officer;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a candidate;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an election agent;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a counting agent;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a public officer on duty at the counting station;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: a member of the Civil Aid Service on duty at the counting station; or

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: a person authorized under subsection (4).

subsection.content: The Returning Officer or a member of the Commission may authorize any person in writing to enter and stay in a counting zone in accordance with the terms of the authorization.

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station may authorize any person in writing to enter and stay in the counting zone of the station in accordance with the terms of the authorization. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: Any member of the public may observe the counting of the votes from an area at a counting station set apart for that purpose by the Officer-in-charge of the counting station unless the Officer-in-charge considers that the presence of such member of the public may— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause disorder or disturbance in the counting station;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disrupt the counting of the votes; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prejudice the secrecy of the individual votes.

subsection.content: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station must ensure that the arrangements for the counting of the votes at the counting zone of the station are such that the candidates and their respective election agents or counting agents are able to observe how individual votes are counted. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s59
section.heading: Order at counting station

subsection.content: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station must keep order at the station. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: film;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take a photograph; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make any audio or video recording,

subsection.continued: in a counting zone without the express permission of a member of the Commission, the Director of Home Affairs or the Officer-in-charge of the counting station.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall, in a counting station or its vicinity—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: use a sound amplifying system or device for any purpose without lawful authority or the express permission of the Officer-in-charge of the station;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: without reasonable excuse, display any propaganda material relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any candidate or his candidate number;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body any member of which is standing as a candidate in the election concerned or a political body; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the election of Rural Representatives; (5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: disrupt the counting of the votes;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: disturb or cause inconvenience to any person except in the execution of his duty; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: otherwise misconduct himself.

subsection.leadIn: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station may take the actions specified in subsection (4A) if— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person contravenes subsection (2) or (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Officer-in-charge reasonably considers that, having regard to the conduct of a person, the person’s presence at the counting station is for a purpose other than that for which the person is entitled or authorized to be so present.

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: The actions specified for the purposes of subsection (4) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to require the person to produce the person’s identity document for inspection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to order the person to leave the counting station or its vicinity immediately. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.content: A person must produce the person’s identity document when required to do so under subsection (4A). (L.N. 163 of 2021)
A person who fails to leave when ordered to do so under subsection (4A) may be removed by a police officer or by a person authorized in writing by the Officer-in-charge. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

No person who is removed under subsection (6) may, without the express permission of the Officer-in-charge, re-enter the counting station or its vicinity before the counting of the votes at the station is finished.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Opening ballot boxes and receptacles

subsection.content: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station must open at the counting zone any ballot box or receptacle kept by or handed over to the Officer-in-charge under section 53, 53A or 60A (as the case may be) by breaking the sealing device in the presence of the candidates or their election agents or counting agents, if present in the counting zone. (L.N. 134 of 2009; L.N. 163 of 2021)

The Officer-in-charge must permit a candidate, or a candidate’s election agent or counting agent, to inspect any paper, other than a ballot paper, taken from the ballot box or receptacle, if so requested by the candidate or agent, before that paper is disposed of. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s60A
section.heading: Arrangements for sorting in ballot paper sorting stations

subsection.leadIn: After opening the ballot boxes under section 60, the Assistant Returning Officer presiding at the ballot paper sorting station must— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sort the ballot papers in each ballot box according to each Rural Area; (L.N. 77 of 2011; 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: count and record the number of ballot papers for each Rural Area; (L.N. 77 of 2011; 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: prepare a statement in writing as to the result of the verification; (L.N. 77 of 2011)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: prepare a statement in writing as to the number of ballot papers recorded for each Rural Area under paragraph (b); (L.N. 77 of 2011; 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: make into separate bundles the sorted ballot papers together with the relevant statement prepared under paragraph (e); (L.N. 77 of 2011)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: place each bundle in a separate receptacle and seal it in the presence of those present at the counting zone; (L.N. 77 of 2011)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: arrange the receptacles to be delivered to the respective counting stations of the relevant Rural Areas and handed over to the Officers-in-charge of the stations; and (L.N. 77 of 2011; 5 of 2014 s. 2)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: send to the Director of Home Affairs the ballot paper accounts, the statements prepared under paragraph (d) and the sealed packets made up under section 53A. (L.N. 77 of 2011; L.N. 134 of 2009; L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: The Assistant Returning Officer must, in preparing the statements under subsection (1)(d), take the action specified in subsection (3) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Officer considers it necessary to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a candidate, an election agent or a counting agent present at the counting zone so requests. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: The action specified for the purposes of subsection (2) is to compare the numbers of the following for a Rural Area with the ballot paper account for that Rural Area—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ballot papers recorded under subsection (1)(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the counterfoils of the ballot papers that have been issued;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ballot papers that have not been issued;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the unused ballot papers; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the spoilt ballot papers. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: A candidate, an election agent or a counting agent present at the counting zone may copy what is recorded in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ballot paper accounts; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the statements prepared under subsection (1)(d). (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.content: In subsection (1), a reference to ballot papers is, if envelopes for containing ballot papers are used in the election, a reference to the envelopes. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s60B
section.heading: Arrangements for verifying number of ballot papers at certain counting stations

subsection.leadIn: If a counting station other than a ballot paper sorting station is used for counting the votes cast at a dedicated polling station, the Officer-in-charge of the counting station must, at the counting zone, after opening all ballot boxes and receptacles in accordance with section 60 and before counting the votes recorded on the ballot papers from each dedicated polling station—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if envelopes for containing ballot papers are used in the election—take out the ballot papers from the envelopes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: count and record the number of ballot papers;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: verify the number of ballot papers by comparing it with—

subparagraph.content: if the ballot papers were sorted in a ballot paper sorting station—the statement prepared under section 60A(1)(e); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prepare a statement in writing as to the result of the verification under paragraph (c); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: after preparing the statement, mix the ballot papers with the ballot papers in at least one of the ballot boxes from a polling station other than a dedicated polling station.

subsection.leadIn: The Officer-in-charge must, in preparing the statement under subsection (1)(d) in respect of the ballot papers that were not sorted in a ballot paper sorting station, take the action specified in subsection (3) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Officer-in-charge considers it necessary to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a candidate, an election agent or a counting agent present at the counting zone so requests.

subsection.leadIn: The action specified for the purposes of subsection (2) is to compare the numbers of the following for the dedicated polling station concerned with the ballot paper account for that station—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ballot papers recorded under subsection (1)(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the counterfoils of the ballot papers that have been issued;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ballot papers that have not been issued;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the unused ballot papers; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the spoilt ballot papers.

subsection.leadIn: A candidate, an election agent or a counting agent present at the counting zone may copy what is recorded in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ballot paper account; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the statement prepared under subsection (1)(d).

subsection.leadIn: If any ballot paper for a Rural Area other than one for which the counting station is designated is found in a ballot box or receptacle, the Officer-in-charge of the station must, in relation to such ballot papers—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sort the ballot papers according to each Rural Area;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: count and record the number of ballot papers for each Rural Area;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prepare a statement in writing as to the number recorded for each Rural Area under paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: make into separate bundles the sorted ballot papers together with the statement prepared under paragraph (c);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: place each bundle in a separate receptacle and seal it in the presence of those present at the counting zone; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: arrange the receptacles to be delivered to the respective counting stations of the relevant Rural Areas and handed over to the Officers-in-charge of the counting stations.
