subsection.leadIn: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station who receives a receptacle delivered under subsection (5)(f) must, at the counting zone, before counting the votes recorded on the ballot papers in the receptacle in accordance with section 61—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: count and record the number of ballot papers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: verify the number by comparing it with the statement prepared under subsection (5)(c);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prepare a statement in writing as to the result of the verification under paragraph (b); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: after preparing the statement under paragraph (c), mix the ballot papers with the other ballot papers for the Rural Area concerned.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Counting of votes

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 60B(1), (5) and (6), ballot papers are to be counted, at the counting zone, using any one or more of the following methods, as determined by the Officer-in-charge of the counting station— (L.N. 134 of 2009; 5 of 2014 s. 52; 12 of 2014 s. 74; L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: ballot papers are to be sorted according to the choices marked on them; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: votes for each candidate are to be counted;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: choice or choices marked on each ballot paper is or are to be made known to the persons present at the counting zone by calling out the name of the candidate or each candidate for whom the vote or a vote is given and the candidate’s candidate number; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: votes recorded for each candidate are to be counted;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the votes recorded on the ballot papers are to be counted with the use of a computer; (5 of 2014 s. 52)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: choice or choices marked on each ballot paper are to be recorded in a form or forms; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: votes recorded for each candidate are to be counted. (5 of 2014 s. 52)

subsection.leadIn: In the course of counting in accordance with subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) or (d), as the case may be— (5 of 2014 s. 52)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any ballot paper—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on which there is any writing or mark by which the elector can possibly be identified;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which appears to be a ballot paper described in section 62(b) or (c); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: which appears to be void for uncertainty,

paragraph.continued: shall be separated and forwarded to the Officer-in-charge; and (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any ballot paper described in section 62(ab), (e), (f), (g), (h) or (i) shall be separated and shall not be counted pursuant to section 62.

subsection.leadIn: The Officer-in-charge must, after counting the votes in accordance with subsection (1), at the counting zone— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: verify the number of ballot papers cast at a polling station other than a dedicated polling station (that station) by comparing it with the ballot paper account for that station; and (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prepare a statement in writing as to the result of the verification under paragraph (a). (12 of 2014 s. 74)

subsection.leadIn: The Officer-in-charge must, in preparing the statement under subsection (3)(b) for that station, take the action specified in subsection (5) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Officer-in-charge considers it necessary to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a candidate, an election agent or a counting agent present at the counting zone so requests. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: The action specified for the purposes of subsection (4) is to compare the numbers of the following for that station with the ballot paper account for that station—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ballot papers counted under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the counterfoils of the ballot papers that have been issued;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ballot papers that have not been issued;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the unused ballot papers; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the spoilt ballot papers. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: A candidate, an election agent or a counting agent present at the counting zone may copy what is recorded in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ballot paper account; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the statement prepared under subsection (3)(b). (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s62
section.heading: Ballot papers not to be counted
section.leadIn: When counting the votes, any ballot paper—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on which there is any writing or mark by which, in the opinion of the Officer-in-charge of a counting station, the elector can possibly be identified; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: which is not marked with a chop issued under section 45; (5 of 2014 s. 53)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to section 63(3)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: used for an election for an Existing Village, which is not marked in accordance with section 48(1)(b); (5 of 2014 s. 53)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: used for an election for an Indigenous Village, which is not marked in accordance with section 48(2)(b); (5 of 2014 s. 53)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: used for an election for a Composite Indigenous Village, which is not marked in accordance with section 48(3)(b); or (5 of 2014 s. 53)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: used for an election for a Market Town, which is not marked in accordance with section 48(4)(b); (5 of 2014 s. 53)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which is substantially mutilated;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: which the Officer-in-charge of a counting station determines under section 63(2)(b)(iii) as being void for uncertainty; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: which has the words “TENDERED” and “重複” endorsed on it;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: which has the words “UNUSED” and “未用” endorsed on it;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: which has the words “SPOILT” and “損壞” endorsed on it; (5 of 2014 s. 53)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: which is unmarked; or (5 of 2014 s. 53)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: which contains votes for a number of candidates exceeding the number of Rural Representative or Rural Representatives to be returned for the Rural Area at the election concerned, (5 of 2014 s. 53)

section.name: s63
section.heading: Determination of validity of questionable ballot papers

subsection.leadIn: If a ballot paper is forwarded to the Officer-in-charge of a counting station under section 61(2)(a)— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a candidate, an election agent or a counting agent, if present at the counting zone, is entitled to inspect the ballot paper; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the candidate or the election agent is entitled to make representations to the Officer-in-charge concerning the ballot paper.

subsection.leadIn: After considering the representations (if any) made under subsection (1)(b), the Officer-in-charge must determine whether the ballot paper— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is valid and the vote shall be counted; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: shall not be counted pursuant to section 62 for—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: being a ballot paper described in section 62(b) or (c); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: being void for uncertainty.

subsection.content: Despite section 62(b), the Officer-in-charge may determine under subsection (2) that a ballot paper which is not marked in accordance with section 48(1)(b), (2)(b) , (3)(b) or (4)(b), as the case may be, is valid and the vote shall be counted in any manner specified in section 61(1), if, subject to other provisions of section 62, he is satisfied that the elector has marked the ballot paper by affixing the chop issued under section 45 on the ballot paper so as to clearly indicate his intention to vote for the candidate or candidates concerned, as the case may be. (5 of 2014 s. 54)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Officer-in-charge determines under subsection (2) that a ballot paper is valid and the vote shall be counted; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a candidate or an election agent objects to the determination,

subsection.continued: the Officer-in-charge must endorse the words “acceptance objected to” and “予以接納的決定遭反對” on the front of the ballot paper.

subsection.leadIn: If the Officer-in-charge determines under subsection (2) that a ballot paper shall not be counted, he shall— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: endorse the words “rejected” and “不予接納” on the front of it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where a candidate or an election agent objects to the determination, endorse the words “rejection objected to” and “不予接納的決定遭反對” on the front of it.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Officer-in-charge determines under subsection (2) that a ballot paper shall not be counted pursuant to section 62 for— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: being a ballot paper described in section 62(b) or (c); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: being void for uncertainty; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any ballot paper is not to be counted pursuant to section 62(ab), (e), (f), (g), (h) or (i), (5 of 2014 s. 54)

subsection.continued: the Officer-in-charge must prepare a statement regarding such ballot paper.

subsection.leadIn: A statement prepared under subsection (6) shall show the respective number of ballot papers under the following heads—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having on it any writing or mark by which the elector can possibly be identified;

paragraph.name: ab
b
paragraph.content: not marked in accordance with section 48(1)(b), (2)(b), (3)(b) or (4)(b) (as the case may be); (5 of 2014 s. 54)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: substantially mutilated;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: void for uncertainty;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: endorsed with the words “TENDERED” and “重複”;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: endorsed with the words “UNUSED” and “未用”;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: endorsed with the words “SPOILT” and “損壞”; (5 of 2014 s. 54)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: unmarked; and (5 of 2014 s. 54)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: containing votes for a number of candidates exceeding the number of Rural Representative or Rural Representatives to be returned for the Rural Area at the election concerned. (5 of 2014 s. 54)

subsection.content: A determination made under subsection (2) shall be final.

To avoid doubt, the Officer-in-charge must not make a determination not to count a ballot paper solely because the name of, and other information relating to, a candidate on the ballot paper are crossed out under section 33(3). (1 of 2019 s. 44)

section.name: s64
section.heading: Final verification of number of ballot papers

subsection.leadIn: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station other than a ballot paper sorting station must, after counting the votes in accordance with section 61 and determining the validity of any questionable ballot paper in accordance with section 63— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: record the number of valid ballot papers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: record the number of ballot papers which are not counted pursuant to section 62;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: verify the numbers recorded under paragraphs (a) and (b) by comparing them with the statement prepared under section 61(3)(b); and (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.def: prepare a statement in writing as to the result of the verification.

subsection.content: A candidate, an election agent or a counting agent may copy what is recorded in the statement prepared under subsection (1)(d).

section.name: s65
section.heading: Result of counting of votes and re-count: 1 counting station

subsection.content: This section applies if there is only 1 counting station for a Rural Area.

subsection.leadIn: After the votes are counted and the number of ballot papers are verified, the Officer-in-charge of a counting station must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: make known the result of the counting of the votes to—

subparagraph.content: the candidates who are present at the counting zone; and
the election agent or a counting agent (if present at the zone) of a candidate who is not present; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the candidates or election agents a reasonable opportunity to make a request under subsection (3).

subsection.content: A candidate or an election agent who is present at the counting zone may request the Officer-in-charge to count again the counted or re-counted votes.
The Officer-in-charge must comply with a request under subsection (3) unless the Officer-in-charge is of the opinion that the request is unreasonable.

If the Officer-in-charge is a Presiding Officer, the Presiding Officer must report to the Returning Officer appointed for the Rural Area concerned the result of the counting of the votes and re-count (if any).

section.name: s65A
section.heading: Result of counting of votes and re-count: 2 or more counting stations

subsection.content: This section applies if there are 2 or more counting stations for a Rural Area.

subsection.leadIn: After the votes are counted and the number of ballot papers are verified, the Officer-in-charge of a counting station must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: make known the result of the counting of the votes at the station to—

subparagraph.content: the candidates who are present at the counting zone; and
the election agent or a counting agent (if present at the zone) of a candidate who is not present; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the candidates or election agents a reasonable opportunity to make a request under subsection (3).

subsection.content: A candidate or an election agent who is present at the counting zone may request the Officer-in-charge to count again the counted or re-counted votes.
The Officer-in-charge must comply with a request under subsection (3) unless the Officer-in-charge is of the opinion that the request is unreasonable.

If the Officer-in-charge is a Presiding Officer, the Presiding Officer must report to the Returning Officer appointed for the Rural Area concerned the result of the counting of the votes and re-count (if any).

After the Returning Officer has obtained the results of the counting of the votes and re-count (if any) of all the counting stations for the Rural Area, the Officer must make known the results to the candidates or their election agents or counting agents who are present at the place specified by the Officer.
A candidate or an election agent who is present at the place may make a request to the Returning Officer for a re-count of all the votes of all the counting stations for the Rural Area.
The Returning Officer must comply with a request under subsection (7) unless the Officer is of the opinion that the request is unreasonable.

subsection.leadIn: If the Returning Officer decides to comply with a request under subsection (7), the Officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the Officer presides at one of the counting stations for the Rural Area—

subparagraph.content: conduct a re-count at the station; and
inform the Presiding Officers of the other counting stations for the Rural Area to conduct a re-count at their respective stations at the same time; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Officer does not preside at any counting station for the Rural Area—inform the Presiding Officers of the counting stations for the Rural Area to conduct a re-count at their respective stations at the same time.

subsection.leadIn: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make known the result of the re-count mentioned in subsection (9) at the station to the candidates or their election agents or counting agents who are present in the station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Officer-in-charge is a Presiding Officer—report that result to the Returning Officer.

subsection.content: After the Returning Officer has obtained the results of the re-counts, the Officer must make known the results to the candidates or their election agents or counting agents who are present at the place specified under subsection (6).

section.name: s65B
section.heading: Conduct of drawing of lots

subsection.leadIn: The drawing of lots for determining the result of an election for a Rural Area under section 31(6) of the Election Ordinance must be conducted at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the office of the Returning Officer appointed for the Rural Area; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other place determined by the Officer.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the drawing of lots must be conducted in the presence of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the candidates who may be returned for the Rural Area at the election as a result of the drawing of lots (relevant candidates); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant candidates’ election agents or counting agents.

subsection.leadIn: The drawing of lots may be conducted in the absence of a relevant candidate if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the candidate cannot be contacted for attending the drawing of lots by the means of contact provided by the candidate on the nomination form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the candidate has notified the Returning Officer that the candidate would not be attending the drawing of lots in person or through the candidate’s election agent or counting agent.

subsection.content: If a relevant candidate is absent for the drawing of lots, the Returning Officer may draw lots on behalf of the candidate, provided that before doing so, the Officer announces on which relevant candidate’s behalf the Officer is drawing the lots.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Returning Officer to declare election result

subsection.content: When the counting of the votes and re-counts, if any, are completed and the result of the election determined, the Returning Officer shall declare as elected the candidate who was successful at the election under section 31(7) of the Election Ordinance.

If, before declaring a successful candidate to be elected, it comes to the knowledge of the Returning Officer that the candidate has died or is disqualified from being elected, section 21(3), (4), (5) and (6) applies.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Notice of election result

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer shall, as soon as practicable after declaring the election result in accordance with section 66(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: display a notice of the result of the election in a prominent place immediately outside each of the counting stations for the Rural Area concerned; and (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: send a copy of the notice of the result of the election to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Chairman of the Commission;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs; (L.N. 130 of 2007)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Secretary for Home and Youth Affairs; (L.N. 144 of 2022)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the Director of Home Affairs; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer.

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall, within 10 days after the date of declaring the election result in accordance with section 66(1), publish a notice in the Gazette, as provided in section 36(1) of the Election Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A notice referred to in subsection (1) or (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an Existing Village is to be in Form 1 set out in Schedule 2; (5 of 2014 s. 55)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an Indigenous Village is to be in Form 2 set out in Schedule 2; (5 of 2014 s. 55)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a Composite Indigenous Village is to be in Form 3 set out in Schedule 2; or (5 of 2014 s. 55)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a Market Town is to be in Form 4 set out in Schedule 2. (5 of 2014 s. 55)

section.name: s68
section.heading: Ballot papers to be sealed

subsection.leadIn: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station must, as soon as practicable after ascertaining the result of the poll, at the counting zone, make up into separate sealed packets— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the counted ballot papers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the counterfoils of the ballot papers that have been issued;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ballot papers that have not been issued; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the ballot papers that are not counted pursuant to section 62.

subsection.leadIn: The Officer-in-charge must endorse on each sealed packet— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a description of its contents;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of the election; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name and the type of the Rural Area concerned. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.content: A candidate, an election agent or a counting agent may be present when the Officer-in-charge makes up the sealed packets and endorses them. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s69
section.heading: Ballot papers, accounts, packets, etc. to be sent to Director of Home Affairs

subsection.leadIn: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station must, as soon as practicable after discharging the Officer-in-charge’s duties under section 68, send to the Director of Home Affairs— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ballot paper accounts; (L.N. 134 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the statement prepared under section 63(6);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the verification statements; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the sealed packets made up under section 68(1);

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: if the Officer-in-charge is a Returning Officer—all notices of withdrawal (if any) delivered to the Returning Officer in accordance with section 14(2); (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: g
h
ha
paragraph.content: if the copy of the relevant final register or registers has been marked under section 45(8)(a)—the marked copy; and (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: any other documents relating to the election for the Rural Area concerned as specified by the Commission. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: A Returning Officer who does not preside at any counting station must, as soon as practicable after discharging the Officer’s duties under section 67(1), send to the Director of Home Affairs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all nomination forms delivered to the Officer in accordance with section 7(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all notices of withdrawal (if any) delivered to the Officer in accordance with section 14(2);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all notices of appointment (if any) given to the Officer under section 24(2), 36(4) or 56(4);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: all notices of revocation (if any) given to the Officer under section 24(4), 36(6) or 56(6); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other documents relating to the election for the Rural Area concerned as specified by the Commission. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s70
section.heading: Inspection of ballot paper kept by Director of Home Affairs
section.content: The Director of Home Affairs shall not permit any person to inspect any ballot paper sent to him under section 69 other than on an order made by a court in proceedings relating to an election petition or in other legal proceedings.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Retention of election materials
section.leadIn: The Director of Home Affairs must— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: retain in the Director’s custody the following that relate to an election for 6 months after the date on which the result of the election is declared in accordance with section 66(1)—

subparagraph.content: the documents sent under section 69; and
the copies or extracts of the relevant final registers in which records have been made under section 45(8)(b); and (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless otherwise directed by an order made by a court in proceedings relating to an election petition or in other legal proceedings, destroy the documents and copies or extracts after the expiry of those 6 months. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

part.name: P8
part.heading: Postponement or Adjournment of Election Proceedings

section.name: s72
section.heading: Postponement or adjournment of polling at all polling stations or counting of votes at all counting stations

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may direct—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the postponement of the poll for an election if, before the commencement of polling, the Commission is of the opinion that the poll; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the postponement of the counting of the votes in respect of the poll for an election if, before the commencement of counting, the Commission is of the opinion that the counting,

subsection.continued: is likely to be obstructed, disrupted, undermined or seriously affected by—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a typhoon or other climatic condition of a serious nature;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: riot or open violence or any danger to public health or safety; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an occurrence which appears to the Commission to be a material irregularity relating to the election, the poll or the counting.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may direct—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the adjournment of the poll for an election if, during the polling, the Commission is of the opinion that the poll; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the adjournment of the counting of the votes in respect of the poll for an election if, during the counting, the Commission is of the opinion that the counting,

subsection.continued: is likely to be or is being obstructed, disrupted, undermined or seriously affected by—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a typhoon or other climatic condition of a serious nature;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: riot or open violence or any danger to public health or safety; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an occurrence which appears to the Commission to be a material irregularity relating to the election, the poll or the counting.

subsection.content: Subject to section 45(3), an elector who has cast a vote at a poll adjourned under subsection (2) is not entitled and shall not be allowed to cast a vote again at the resumed polling.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Adjournment of polling at a particular polling station or counting of votes at a particular counting station

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer appointed for a polling station may, after consulting the Returning Officer, direct the adjournment of a poll for an election at that polling station if, during the polling, the Presiding Officer is of the opinion that the poll is likely to be or is being obstructed, disrupted, undermined or seriously affected by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a typhoon or other climatic condition of a serious nature;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: riot or open violence or any danger to public health or safety; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an occurrence which appears to the Presiding Officer to be a material irregularity relating to the election, the poll or the counting concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The Officer-in-charge of a counting station may direct the adjournment of the counting of the votes in respect of the poll for an election at the counting station if, during the counting, the Officer-in-charge is of the opinion that the counting is likely to be or is being obstructed, disrupted, undermined or seriously affected by— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a typhoon or other climatic condition of a serious nature;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: riot or open violence or any danger to public health or safety; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an occurrence which appears to the Officer-in-charge to be a material irregularity relating to the election, the poll or the counting. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.content: If the Officer-in-charge is a Presiding Officer or an Assistant Returning Officer, the Officer-in-charge may only exercise the power under subsection (2) after consulting the Returning Officer appointed for the Rural Area concerned. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s74
section.heading: Publication of postponement or adjournment of polling or counting

subsection.leadIn: If the Commission directs the postponement or adjournment of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a poll; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the counting of the votes in respect of a poll,

subsection.continued: it shall publish the direction in such manner as it considers practicable.

subsection.content: If a Presiding Officer directs the adjournment of a poll at a polling station, the Officer must publish the direction in a way the Officer considers practicable. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

If the Officer-in-charge of a counting station directs the adjournment of the counting of the votes at the station, the Officer-in-charge must publish the direction in a way the Officer-in-charge considers practicable. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s75
section.heading: Procedure after adjournment of polling

subsection.leadIn: If a poll is adjourned, the Presiding Officer shall, as soon as practicable after receiving the direction under section 72(2) or giving the direction under section 73(1), as the case may be, make up into separate sealed packets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the counterfoils of the ballot papers that have been issued;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ballot papers that have not been issued;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the unused ballot papers;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the spoilt ballot papers; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the copy of the relevant final register or registers has been marked under section 45(8)(a)—the marked copy, (L.N. 163 of 2021)

subsection.continued: and, at a polling station used for polling for more than one Rural Area, make separate sealed packets for each Rural Area, in the presence of the persons who are present in the polling station. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer shall, as soon as practicable after complying with subsection (1), deliver—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sealed ballot box or boxes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sealed packets referred to in subsection (1),

subsection.continued: to the Returning Officer or the relevant Returning Officers.

subsection.leadIn: If it is impracticable to make delivery under subsection (2), the Presiding Officer shall deposit the sealed ballot box or boxes and sealed packets in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a safe place within the polling station;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is no safe place referred to in paragraph (a), a safe place within a police station or a public building close to the polling station; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if there is no safe place referred to in paragraph (a) or (b), a safe place within a secure building close to the polling station,

subsection.continued: until the delivery becomes practicable.

subsection.leadIn: Upon the delivery to the Returning Officer or the relevant Returning Officers of the sealed ballot box or boxes and sealed packets under subsection (2), the Returning Officer or the relevant Returning Officers shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: take such steps as are determined by the Commission for the purpose of ensuring the safety and security of the sealed ballot box or boxes and sealed packets; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remain in charge of the sealed ballot box or boxes and sealed packets and be responsible for their safety and security until the resumption of the poll.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Procedure after postponement or adjournment of counting

subsection.leadIn: If the counting of the votes in respect of a poll is postponed or adjourned at a counting station, the Officer-in-charge of the station must, in the presence of the persons, if any, present in the station— (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (in the case of adjournment) cease the counting;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: deposit all of the following items in a place specified in subsection (2)—

subparagraph.content: the ballot box or boxes (whether opened or not);
the receptacle or receptacles (if any);
the ballot papers (whether counted or not);
the ballot papers endorsed with the words “TENDERED” and “重複”;
the ballot paper account or accounts;
the verification statement;
the sealed packets made up under section 53 or 53A;
any other materials relating to the election that the Officer-in-charge considers appropriate. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take such steps as are determined by the Commission for the purpose of ensuring the safety and security of the materials so deposited; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: remain in charge of the materials so deposited and be responsible for their safety and security until the conduct or resumption of the counting of the votes.

subsection.leadIn: The place specified for the purposes of subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a safe place within the counting station;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is no safe place as mentioned in paragraph (a)—a safe place within a police station or a public building close to the counting station;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if there is no safe place as mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b)—a safe place within a secure building, which may be a residential building, close to the counting station; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if there is no safe place as mentioned in paragraph (a), (b) or (c)—a safe place within any other police station or public building or, in the absence of such a station or building, a safe place in any other building, which may be a residential building. (L.N. 163 of 2021)

section.name: s77
section.heading: Resumption of postponed or adjourned polling or counting

subsection.leadIn: If a poll is postponed, the Commission shall appoint—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a date within 14 days after the date of the postponed poll as the new polling day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the polling hours on the new polling day.

subsection.leadIn: If a poll is adjourned, the Commission shall appoint—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a date within 14 days after the date of the adjourned poll as the day on which the polling shall resume; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the polling hours for the resumed polling.

subsection.content: If the counting of the votes in respect of a poll is postponed, the Commission shall appoint a date within 14 days after the date of the postponed counting as the day on which the counting shall be conducted.

If the counting of the votes in respect of a poll is adjourned, the Commission shall appoint a date within 14 days after the date of the adjourned counting as the day on which the counting shall resume.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after an appointment under subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4), as the case may be, is made, the Commission shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish a notice of the appointment in the Gazette; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: announce the appointed date and, where applicable, the appointed polling hours by such other means as the Commission considers appropriate.

subsection.content: The appointment of a date under this section for holding a rural by-election shall be subject to section 21(2) and (3) of the Election Ordinance. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

section.name: s78
section.heading: Certain officers cannot act as candidate’s agent
section.leadIn: A Returning Officer, an Assistant Returning Officer, a Presiding Officer, a polling officer and a counting officer may not act as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an election agent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an election expense agent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a polling agent; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a counting agent,

section.name: s79
section.heading: Employees of candidates shall not act as electoral officers
section.leadIn: No person shall, while in the employment of a candidate, act as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an Assistant Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a Presiding Officer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a polling officer; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a counting officer,

section.name: s79A
section.heading: Certain visitors of electors in custody not to canvass for votes

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person (visitor) visits in a certain capacity an elector in custody for a business or official purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: another person who is not acting in that capacity is not allowed to visit the elector for that purpose,

subsection.continued: the visitor commits an offence if he, during the visit, canvasses for votes for the purpose of an election.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Act done in the absence of candidates or agents still valid
section.leadIn: If an act is required or authorized under this Regulation to be done in the presence of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a candidate or all candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an election agent, a polling agent or a counting agent,

section.continued: that act shall not be invalid solely for the reason that such person or persons are not present when the act is performed.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Declaration of secrecy

subsection.leadIn: No person (other than a person specified in subsection (2)) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter a polling station or a counting zone without making a declaration of secrecy in the specified form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stay in a polling station or a counting zone without carrying with him the declaration of secrecy.

subsection.leadIn: The following persons are specified for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector who comes to a polling station for the purpose of voting;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a child accompanying an elector who comes to a polling station for the purpose of voting;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a police officer, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or an officer of any law enforcement agency on duty at a polling station or a counting station; and (L.N. 134 of 2009)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a member of the Civil Aid Service on duty at a polling station or a counting station.

subsection.leadIn: A declaration of secrecy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a Returning Officer shall be made in the presence of a commissioner defined in section 2 of the Oaths and Declarations Ordinance (Cap. 11); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by any other person shall be made in the presence of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a Returning Officer;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a member of the Commission;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a justice of the peace;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a commissioner referred to in paragraph (a); or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Secrecy

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), divulge to any person whether an elector has or has not applied for a ballot paper or voted;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), divulge to any other person the identity of an elector in custody; (L.N. 134 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: communicate to another person any information obtained at the counting of the votes as to the candidate for whom a vote has been given on any particular ballot paper;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: interfere with an elector when he is marking the ballot paper;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: interfere with or attempt to interfere with a ballot box, a ballot paper (including a ballot paper that has not been counted pursuant to section 62), a copy of the relevant final register in printed form marked under section 45(8)(a), a statement prepared under section 63(6) or a verification statement; (L.N. 163 of 2021)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: without the permission of the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, obtain or attempt to obtain in any manner within a polling station, a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone information as to the candidate for whom an elector is about to vote or has voted;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: communicate to another person any information obtained within a polling station as to the candidate for whom an elector is about to vote or has voted; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: directly or indirectly induce an elector to display a ballot paper marked by the elector so as to make known to any person any information as to the candidate for whom the elector has voted.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(a) or (aa) does not apply to— (L.N. 134 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any act authorized by law; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: anything done at the direction of a police officer or an officer of the Independent Commission Against Corruption investigating an offence under—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: sections 3, 4 and 8 of the Prevention of Bribery Ordinance (Cap. 201);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: section 13B of the Independent Commission Against Corruption Ordinance (Cap. 204);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541); or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554).

section.name: s83
section.heading: Manner of giving notice

subsection.leadIn: Notices under the following provisions may be delivered by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission— (12 of 2014 s. 63)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 12(1) (decision on validity of nomination);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 25(1) (notice to candidates of appointment of election agents);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 29(1) (polling notice);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: section 34(2) (boundaries of no canvassing zone and no staying zone);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: section 34(5) (variation of no canvassing zone and no staying zone);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: section 42(4) (allocation of candidate numbers by drawing of lots); or (12 of 2014 s. 50)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: section 55(3) (place and time of counting of votes). (12 of 2014 s. 50)

subsection.content: A notice under section 34(5) may be given orally if delivering it in accordance with subsection (1) is not practicable or is not suitable in the circumstances. (12 of 2014 s. 63)

section.name: s84
section.heading: Specified forms

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may specify forms for the purposes of this Regulation on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: nomination of candidates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: withdrawal of candidature.

subsection.content: The Director of Home Affairs may specify forms (other than those referred to in subsection (1)) for the purposes of this Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: Forms specified under subsections (1) and (2) shall be made available by the Director of Home Affairs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: free of charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during ordinary business hours at his office.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) does not apply to the specified forms referred to in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 16(2) (notice declaring candidates to be duly elected in uncontested election);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 25(2) (notice to candidates of appointment of election agents);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 29(1) (polling notice); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 54(2) (ballot paper account).

section.name: s84A
section.heading: Officer-in-charge may perform functions through counting officers

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Officer-in-charge of a counting station may perform any act that the Officer-in-charge is required or authorized to perform under this Regulation through a counting officer.

subsection.leadIn: The Officer-in-charge may not delegate under subsection (1) the power to do any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: adjourn the counting of the votes under section 73(2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the validity of a ballot paper under section 63(2);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: decide as to whether the vote recorded on a ballot paper is to be counted.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Limit on Returning Officer’s power to delegate
section.leadIn: A Returning Officer may not delegate to an Assistant Returning Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the power under section 27 of the Election Ordinance to decide on the validity of a nomination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a determination under section 63(2); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the declaration of the result of an election under section 31(7) of the Election Ordinance.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Powers, duties and functions of Director of Home Affairs

subsection.content: The Director of Home Affairs is subject to the directions of the Commission in the performance of his functions under this Regulation.
The Director of Home Affairs may delegate his powers, duties or functions under this Regulation to a member of the staff of the Department of Home Affairs.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Reporting of irregularities

subsection.content: If the Director of Home Affairs is of the opinion that an irregularity has occurred in relation to an election, a poll or the counting of votes in respect of a poll, or a Returning Officer or a Presiding Officer is of the opinion that an irregularity has occurred in relation to an election, a poll or the counting of the votes in respect of a poll, he shall make a report in writing to the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: A report of an irregularity shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after the Director of Home Affairs or the Officer concerned becomes aware of it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any case not later than 14 days after the polling day.

subsection.content: If the Director of Home Affairs is of the opinion that a material irregularity has occurred or is likely to occur in relation to an election, a poll or the counting of the votes in respect of a poll, or a Returning Officer or a Presiding Officer is of the opinion that a material irregularity has occurred or is likely to occur in relation to an election, a poll or the counting of the votes in respect of a poll, he shall immediately make a report to the Commission in such manner as he considers expedient in the circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: If a report is made under subsection (3) otherwise than in writing, the Director of Home Affairs or the Officer concerned shall make a report also in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after the making of the first-mentioned report; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any case not later than 30 days after the polling day.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Offence

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes section 35(2), (5), (7) or (9), 37(1), 38(2), (5), (7), (9) or (11), 58(3), 59(2), (3), (5) or (7), 78 or 79 commits an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months. (L.N. 134 of 2009 and L.N. 197 of 2009)

Any person who contravenes section 38(4), 47(8), or 82(1) commits an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (11 of 2012 s. 21; 5 of 2014 s. 56)

section.name: s90
section.heading: Offence of false statement

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes a statement which he knows to be false in a material particular in an election related document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recklessly makes a statement which is incorrect in a material particular in an election related document; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: omits a material particular in an election related document,

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Any person (the first-mentioned person) who directly or indirectly by himself or by another person on his behalf conspires with, incites, compels, induces, coerces, intimidates or persuades any other person to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a false statement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide information which the first-mentioned person knows to be wrong in a material particular,

subsection.continued: in an election related document commits an offence.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under this section shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
An offence under subsection (1) or (2) is an offence prescribed for the purposes of sections 9(1)(d)(iv) and 23(1)(e)(iv) of the Election Ordinance. (5 of 2014 s. 57)

subsection.def: In this section, election related document (與選舉有關的文件) means a form, declaration, application, notice, statement or nomination form required or used for the purposes of the Election Ordinance or this Regulation.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Interpretation (Part 10)

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: Court (法院) means the Court of First Instance;
Director (署長) means the Director of Home Affairs;

def.name: ElectionPeriod
def.leadIn: election period (選舉期), in relation to an election, means the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning on the first day of the nomination period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: ending on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the day on which a declaration is made under section 29 of the Election Ordinance or section 19; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the day on which the polling ends;

subsection.def: publish (發布) means print, display, exhibit, distribute, post up, publicly announce or make publicly known by any other means, and includes continue to publish.

subsection.content: Any person who authorizes the publication of an election advertisement is taken to have published the advertisement for the purposes of this Part.
If a Returning Officer has not been appointed for a Rural Area, any reference in this Part to a Returning Officer is to be construed as a reference to the Director. (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: A document published by a candidate during an election period that gives details of the work done by the candidate in the capacity of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: a member of the Election Committee; (8 of 2022 s. 19)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Legislative Council;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a member of a District Council;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a member of the Heung Yee Kuk;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Chairman or Vice-Chairman or a member of the Executive Committee of a Rural Committee within the meaning of section 3(3)(a) of the Heung Yee Kuk Ordinance (Cap. 1097); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a Rural Representative, (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.continued: is an election advertisement for the purposes of this Part.

section.name: s92
section.heading: Requirements applicable to election advertisements

subsection.leadIn: A candidate who publishes an election advertisement must comply with subsection (2) or (3) in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the advertisement and any information related to the advertisement required by the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the publication is by means of displaying the advertisement in the form of a bill or poster within the meaning of section 104E(4) of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132), the permission obtained for the purposes of section 104A(1) of that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the advertisement is of a kind referred to in subsection (1) or (2) of section 27 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554), the consent referred to in subsection (1A), (1B), (2A) or (2B) of that section.

subsection.leadIn: A candidate must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: make an electronic copy of the advertisement, information, permission or consent available for inspection on an open platform maintained by the Director or a person authorized by the Director (Central Platform) in the manner and within the time specified by the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: make an electronic copy of the advertisement, information, permission or consent available for inspection on an open platform maintained by the candidate or a person authorized by the candidate (Candidate’s Platform) in the manner and within the time specified by the Commission until the end of the period for which copies of election returns are available for inspection under section 41 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554) and provide information about the Candidate’s Platform required by the Commission in the manner and within the time specified by the Commission; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the Commission considers that it is technically impracticable to make available for inspection on the Central Platform or a Candidate’s Platform an election advertisement published through the Internet by means of an open platform, provide a hyperlink to that open platform on the Central Platform or Candidate’s Platform in the manner and within the time specified by the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: A candidate must provide, in the manner and within the time specified by the Commission, to the Returning Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information and 2 copies of the advertisement in paper form or any other form specified by the Commission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a hard copy of the permission or consent.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not publish a printed election advertisement that fails to show, in the English or Chinese language—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the printer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which it was printed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of copies printed.

subsection.content: Subsection (4) does not apply to an election advertisement that is printed in a newspaper registered under section 7 of the Registration of Local Newspapers Ordinance (Cap. 268).

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) does not apply to the publication of a printed election advertisement if, not later than 7 days after the advertisement is published, the publisher, or a person authorized by the publisher, has provided to the Returning Officer a statutory declaration that states—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the printer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which it was printed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of copies printed.

subsection.content: The Returning Officer must make available for public inspection a copy of each of any advertisement, information, permission, consent or statutory declaration provided under subsection (3) or (6) from when it is provided until the end of the period for which copies of election returns are available for inspection under section 41 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554).

The Director must publicize any platform maintained under subsection (2)(a) and ensure that the platform is maintained until the end of the period for which copies of election returns are available for inspection under section 41 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554).
A person who fails to comply with subsection (1) or (4) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Court may grant relief for election advertisements

subsection.content: A person who publishes an election advertisement without complying with section 92(1)(a) or (4) may apply to the Court for an order under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: On the hearing of an application made under subsection (1), the Court may make an order excepting the act which would, but for the order, constitute an offence under subsection (9) of section 92, from the relevant requirement under that section, but only if the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the non-compliance was due to inadvertence, an accidental miscalculation or any reasonable cause and was not due to bad faith; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the Court requires notice of the application to be given in Hong Kong, the notice has been given; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: believes it to be just that the act be so excepted.

subsection.content: If an application is made under subsection (1), no prosecution against the applicant for not having complied with section 92(1)(a) or (4) may be instituted or carried on until the application is disposed of by the Court.
An applicant is not liable to be convicted of an offence under section 92(9) if the non-compliance by the applicant with section 92(1)(a) or (4) is the subject of an order made under subsection (2).

section.name: s94
section.heading: Power to seize, etc. election advertisements
section.content: The Returning Officer or any person authorized by that Officer may seize and dispose of, or destroy, or obliterate, or cover with any materials that Officer or the person thinks fit, any election advertisement on display and in respect of which any requirement in section 92 has not been complied with.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Commission may grant exemption
section.content: The Commission may, by notice published in the Gazette, exempt any class or type of election advertisement from the application of any provision of section 92.

part.name: P11
part.heading: Electronic Copy or Extract of Final Register for Purposes of Section 45(8)(b)

section.name: s96
section.heading: Interpretation (Part 11)
section.def: obtain access (取覽), in relation to an FR electronic copy or extract, includes causing an electronic device to perform a function so as to obtain access to the data or information contained in the FR electronic copy or extract.

section.name: s97
section.heading: FR electronic copy or extract

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, for the purposes of section 45(8)(b), create and maintain an electronic copy or extract of the final register, or of part of the final register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be stored on an electronic platform; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: access to which can be obtained through the Internet by using an electronic device.

subsection.content: An FR electronic copy or extract is to contain the identity document numbers of the electors and such additional particulars or information that the Director of Home Affairs thinks fit to include.

section.name: s98
section.heading: Protection of FR electronic copy or extract

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person obtains access to an FR electronic copy or extract without legal authority to do so.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), an individual has legal authority to obtain access to an FR electronic copy or extract if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the individual is a Presiding Officer or polling officer who is authorized by the Commission to use the FR electronic copy or extract for the purposes of section 45(8)(b) and the individual so uses the FR electronic copy or extract in compliance with the terms of the authorization; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the individual is authorized by the Commission to assist in making the FR electronic copy or extract available for the use mentioned in paragraph (b) and the individual acts in compliance with the terms of the authorization.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, without lawful excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: damages any data or information contained in an FR electronic copy or extract; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise tampers with an FR electronic copy or extract to make its operation defective.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (3) is liable on conviction on indictment to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Commission may authorize access to FR electronic copy or extract

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Commission may, for the purposes of section 98(2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grant an authorization to an individual; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the terms of the authorization.

subsection.leadIn: An authorization granted to an individual under subsection (1) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the name and appropriate identification details of the individual; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: set out the terms of the authorization.
